0.title: UP to observe holiday on Nov 28 to mark Guru Tegh Bahadur Shaheedi Diwas
0.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government has announced a holiday on November 28 to mark the occasion of Guru Tegh Bahadur Shaheedi Diwas. Guru Tegh Bahadur, who is the ninth Sikh Guru, was born in Amritsar in 1621 and was martyred under the rule of the Mughal emperor Aurangzeb in 1675. Guru Tegh Bahadur is also popularly known as 'Hind di Chaddar'.

1.title: Remove encroachment on Senapati Bapat Marg in a month: HC to BMC
1.article_body: The Bombay High Court has ordered BMC's G North ward to clear illegal encroachment from the Senapati Bapat Marg in a month or face action. The encroachment in the Mahim area causes traffic snarls and difficulties for pedestrians. Four Mahim residents, who moved the HC against this, said that despite multiple requests to BMC, no permanent steps have been taken.

2.title: Kamal Haasan hospitalised in Chennai after complaining of uneasiness and fever: Reports
2.article_body: Kamal Haasan has reportedly been admitted to Sri Ramachandra Medical Centre (SRMC) hospital in Chennai, after complaining of uneasiness and fever. The 68-year-old actor, who was in Hyderabad a few days ago, was advised by doctors to rest. He is likely to get discharged on Thursday.

3.title: Everything I do or have done right is because of Priyanka: Nick
3.article_body: Singer-actor Nick Jonas said that everything he does or has done right is because of Priyanka Chopra. Describing his relationship with Priyanka, Nick said that the two have a connection where they discuss their decisions on business, emotional and creative matters and even voice their opinions to each other. He said that all such conversations with Priyanka have been "invaluable".

4.title: No bigger proof of govt's 'inefficiency' than change of CMs in Guj: Cong MP
4.article_body: There can’t be a bigger proof of a government’s "inefficiency" than the move to change its CMs in BJP-ruled Gujarat, Congress MP Manish Tewari said. "What will be the plight of (current CM) is for public to decide. There cannot be a bigger living example of governance failure than the fact that you've to change your CMs thrice," Tewari added.

5.title: This was the most important game: Neuer after Germany's loss vs Japan
5.article_body: Germany captain Manuel Neuer said he's "totally frustrated" with the manner in which his team "gave up" during their 1-2 loss against Japan in their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener. "We're under pressure...This was the most important game," added Neuer. "The imperative that we wanted to score the second goal was...missing...We brought Japan back into the game," he stated.

6.title: Even if I die, continue peaceful protests: Farmer leader on fast to followers
6.article_body: Bharti Kisan Union (Ekta Sidhupur) President Jagjit Singh Dallewal, whose fast entered its fifth day on Wednesday, said, "Even if I die, I appeal to farmer colleagues to carry out their protests in a peaceful manner." Dallewal has pledged to fast unto death till the Punjab government agrees to various demands of the farmers.

7.title: Tata Consumer to acquire Bisleri for about ₹7,000 crore: Report
7.article_body: Ramesh Chauhan is divesting Bisleri International to Tata Consumer Products Limited for about ₹6,000-7,000 crore, as per a report. The report added that Chauhan doesn't have a successor to take Bisleri to the next level of expansion. Chauhan reportedly called it a "painful" decision and said that The Tata Group "will nurture and take care of it even better."

8.title: German officials learn cricket from Indian colleagues at Consulate General; video viral
8.article_body: German Consul in Bengaluru, Achim Burkart, took to Twitter to share a video and wrote, "During lunch break my Indian colleagues try to teach my German colleagues how to play cricket." "Happy to report that the consulate is still intact," he added. The video shared by Burkart went viral on social media.

9.title: Nirav Modi seeks permission to appeal extradition in UK Supreme Court
9.article_body: Fugitive diamantaire Nirav Modi filed an application in the High Court in London, seeking permission to appeal against his extradition order in UK Supreme Court. He is currently behind bars at London's Wandsworth prison. The court had rejected his appeal earlier this month while ordering his extradition to India to face charges in the ₹14,000-crore Punjab National Bank scam case.

10.title: Over 43,000 people fined for not wearing seat belts in Mumbai
10.article_body: At least 43,689 drivers and passengers have been fined by Mumbai Traffic Police for not wearing seat belts, including both front and rear, since November 1. According to official data, 22,970 challans were issued to drivers and 20,719 to passengers. Wearing rear seat belts has been made mandatory since November 10.

11.title: Bombay HC denies divorce to Pune man who lied about wife being HIV+
11.article_body: The Bombay High Court rejected the divorce petition of a 44-year-old Pune resident who falsely claimed that his wife was HIV positive and sought divorce on that ground. The man claimed that his wife while undergoing treatment for "herpes" in 2004 tested positive for HIV. However, the man failed to submit any proof to the court to substantiate his claim.

12.title: 'Should Twitter offer a general amnesty to suspended accounts?' Musk launches new poll
12.article_body: Days after reinstating several banned Twitter accounts, Elon Musk on Wednesday held another poll on whether the site should offer a "general amnesty" to suspended accounts, provided the users have not broken the law. Earlier, Musk ran a similar poll asking Twitter users if former US President Donald Trump's account should be reinstated, following which 51.8% voted yes.

13.title: Scindia to inaugurate airport multilevel parking tomorrow: Pune MP
13.article_body: Pune MP Girish Bapat has said that Union Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia will inaugurate the multilevel parking at the airport in the city tomorrow. "The parking lot will also provide other facilities to passengers," he added. Earlier, Airports Authority of India said that Indian Air Force has approved over 200 slots daily for civil flight operations for Pune airport.

14.title: Comedy movies never get their due, it's not easy: Kiara Advani
14.article_body: Actress Kiara Advani said that doing comedy on screen looks easy but it's "very difficult" for the actors to perform. "It (comedy movies) never gets its due but it's not easy," she expressed. Director Shashank Khaitan said, "Comedy is the toughest to do...it's the toughest to write, act and direct." Kiara's next film is Shashank's upcoming directorial 'Govinda Naam Mera'.

15.title: Man's flight ticket shows 2 destinations and departures, social media users react
15.article_body: A passenger named Auditya Venkatesh was booking an AirAsia flight ticket from Hyderabad to Bengaluru when his arrival and departure were mixed up in the confirmation popup, showing he was booking ticket from Hyderabad to Bengaluru as well as from Bengaluru to Kolkata. While AirAsia said it was a "glitch", a Twitter user wrote, "Bro's travelling in the multiverse now."

16.title: Pic of Senegal's football team coach goes viral for his resemblance to Snoop Dogg
16.article_body: A picture of Senegal football coach Aliou Cisse is going viral on social media as several users pointed out that he looks like American rapper Snoop Dogg. The rapper reacted to the picture of Cisse with a football emoticon. "Why is Snoop Dogg the coach of Senegal?" read a tweet posted by a user.

17.title: Housing projects issued notices seeking ₹14,184 cr dues in Gr Noida
17.article_body: Greater Noida Authority has issued notices to 143 housing projects in the city seeking recovery of ₹14,184 crore dues. "If...realtors fail to pay their respective dues, we'll have to cancel their allotment according to the terms of the lease-deed," an official of the agency said. Moreover, an official of the Noida Authority said that it issued 15 more recovery notices.

18.title: ICC releases latest ODI team rankings, England lose top spot
18.article_body: The ICC has released the latest ODI team rankings, with England losing their top spot following a 0-3 defeat against Australia in the recently concluded three-match ODI series. New Zealand are on top of the rankings with 114 rating points, while England are now second with 113 rating points. India are third, while Australia are ranked fourth.

19.title: SL cricketer Chamika Karunaratne banned for 1 year over indiscipline at T20 WC
19.article_body: Sri Lanka all-rounder Chamika Karunaratne has been handed a one-year ban by Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) over indiscipline. The 26-year-old was found to have breached multiple clauses of the SLC's player agreement during the recently concluded T20 World Cup 2022 in Australia. The all-rounder pleaded guilty to all charges levelled against him. He has also been fined $5,000.

20.title: World’s 6th richest man Buffett donates $758 million in Berkshire shares to charity
20.article_body: Warren Buffett has donated Berkshire Hathaway's shares valued at more than $758 million to charities, including one named after his late wife. With a net worth of  $110.4 billion, 92-year-old Buffett is the world's sixth richest person. Since 2006, Buffett has donated over half of his Berkshire shares, worth more than $46 billion at the time of the donations.

21.title: 14-yr-old boy proposes 13-yr-old girl on social media, booked in Pune
21.article_body: A 14-year-old boy, a Class 8 student, has reportedly been booked by Pune Police for proposing to his 13-year-old classmate on social media. The boy posted pictures of the girl on social media, asking her to be his wife. However, the girl informed her parents about it. "We have issued a notice to the boy's parents," said police.

22.title: Actor Vikram Gokhale's daughter dismisses death reports, says 'He's on life support'
22.article_body: Actor Vikram Gokhale's daughter has dismissed reports about his death, saying that his condition is still critical and he is on life support. "Keep praying for him," she further said. Gokhale, who has starred in several Bollywood films including 'Hum Dil De Chuke Sanam' and 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa', won the National Award for the best actor for Marathi film 'Anumati'.

23.title: Donald Trump reported $900 million in losses in 2 years, jury told
23.article_body: Donald Trump's longtime accountant has testified that the ex-US president reported losses on his tax returns every year for a decade, confirming long-held suspicions about his tax practices. Trump reported losses of $700 million in 2009 and $200 million in 2010, Donald Bender said. Bender was the first defence witness in the tax fraud trial of two of Trump's companies.

24.title: 'Should Twitter offer amnesty to suspended accounts?' asks Musk, starts poll
24.article_body: Billionaire CEO Elon Musk on Wednesday started a poll on Twitter asking users if the platform should "offer a general amnesty to suspended accounts". He said the amnesty will only be offered to accounts that "haven't broken the law or engaged in egregious spam". In the poll's initial hours, over 72% votes of 1.2 million polled votes were for 'Yes'.

25.title: I didn't form content moderation council as 'activist groups' broke the deal: Musk
25.article_body: Twitter CEO Elon Musk on Wednesday said he reinstated previously banned Twitter accounts before the platform got a content moderation council as "a large coalition of political/social activist groups...broke the deal". "[They had] agreed not to try to kill Twitter by starving us of advertising revenue if I [formed the council]," Musk said. He earlier reinstated billionaire Donald Trump's Twitter.

26.title: New York becomes 1st US state to restrict cryptocurrency mining
26.article_body: New York Governor Kathy Hochul on Tuesday signed a law temporarily restricting cryptocurrency mining in the state over environmental concerns, making it the first US state to do so. For the next two years, unless a proof-of-work mining company uses 100% renewable energy, it won't be allowed to expand or renew permits. New entrants won't be allowed to come online.

27.title: ED seizes FD worth ₹16 cr from Hyd-based firm for FEMA violation
27.article_body: Fixed deposits worth ₹16 crore, belonging to a Hyderabad-based firm, which provides seismic survey services to oil exploration companies in India and abroad, have been seized by the ED for violating the foreign exchange law. The action was taken against Alphageo (India) Limited, which was raided by the Income Tax Department in 2019, the ED said.

28.title: Karnataka govt constitutes an elephant task force
28.article_body: The Karnataka government set up an elephant task force to check the menace caused by the wild animal in the state. The Deputy Conservator of Forests will head the task force and it'll be set up in Hassan, Chikkamagaluru, Mysuru and Kodagu districts where the problem has peaked. Every task force headquarter will have a phone number shared with citizens.

29.title: Spain record their biggest-ever win in FIFA World Cup history
29.article_body: Spain on Wednesday defeated Costa Rica 7-0 in their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener. It's their biggest-ever victory in FIFA World Cup history. Their previous biggest win in FIFA World Cup history had come in the 1998 edition, when they defeated Bulgaria 6-1. Ferran Torres scored a brace for Spain today, while remaining goals were scored by five different players.

30.title: Taliban publicly lashes 12 people, including three women, in Afghanistan
30.article_body: The Taliban lashed twelve people, including three women, at a provincial stadium in Logar on Wednesday. The lashings were attended by hundreds of spectators, following invitations being sent out by the administration. The lashings were announced after the individuals were convicted by a local court of theft or adultery. Each individual received between 21 and 39 lashes.

31.title: Russia continues to batter Ukraine's power grid
31.article_body: Russia on Wednesday continued to batter Ukraine's power grid with multiple air strikes. Several regions in the country reported power outages. There was no official confirmation on how many infrastructure targets were hit. Meanwhile, authorities said three people died when one of the air strikes hit a two-storey building in capital Kyiv.

32.title: Over 80,000 delegates will attend COP28 In Dubai: UAE minister
32.article_body: At least 80,000 delegates, including over 140 senior foreign government leaders, will attend COP28, which will be held in Dubai next year, said UAE Minister Sultan Ahmed Al Jaber. He said the Gulf nation has invested over $50 billion in clean energy projects. The UAE is also the home of the International Renewable Energy Agency's headquarters.

33.title: Ambuja Cements releases pledge of 50.05% in its subsidiary ACC
33.article_body: Ambuja Cement has released the existing pledge of 50.05% shareholding in its subsidiary ACC as of November 19, it said in a stock exchange filing. After the release, Ambuja's holding pledged with lenders has come down to 2.16% from 52.21% earlier. The company had pledged its total 9.39 crore shares of ACC on September 26.

34.title: European Parliament's website hit by cyberattack
34.article_body: The European Parliament's website on Wednesday was hit by a cyberattack by a pro-Russia group, said the legislature's President Roberta Metsola. The cyber attack came just hours after European Parliament lawmakers supported a resolution to declare Russia a state sponsor of terrorism. Metsola said a "pro-Kremlin group has claimed responsibility" for the "sophisticated cyberattack".

35.title: Volkswagen-owned brands halt paid activities on Twitter
35.article_body: Volkswagen, owner of Audi, Seat, Cupra, Lamborghini, Bentley, Ducati and Porsche, said that it recommended all its brands pause paid activities on Twitter, after Elon Musk took ownership of the social media platform. Audi has halted all activities, a Volkswagen spokesperson said. "We are monitoring the situation closely and will decide on the next steps depending on developments," Audi said.

36.title: Jain given dry fruits in jail, why no action taken against admin: Baghel
36.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel reacted to videos of jailed Delhi minister Satyendar Jain from his cell, questioning why Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal hasn't removed Jain from his post. "[Jain] has been provided with a masseur and dry fruits. How these things are being given to him?" Baghel said. "What action has been taken against the jail administration?" he further said.

37.title: Telcos' adjusted gross revenue rises 17.91% YoY to ₹60,530 cr in Q1: TRAI
37.article_body: Telecom service providers' adjusted gross revenue (AGR) grew 17.91% on a year-over-year basis to ₹60,530 crore in April-June quarter, according to data by Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI). The AGR of telecom service providers stood at ₹51,335 crore in June 2021 quarter. Bharti Airtel recorded the highest growth in year-over-year AGR by 25.15% to ₹17,140.56 crore.

38.title: Union Minister Kaushal Kishore's nephew found hanging at his home in Lucknow
38.article_body: Union Minister Kaushal Kishore's nephew, Nand Kishore, was found hanging at his home in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow on Wednesday. Preliminary investigation suggests that Nand Kishore, who used to work as a property dealer, died by suicide. According to Nand Kishore's son Vishal, his father was troubled for the past few days. Police said he had married twice.

39.title: Why didn't Ronaldo receive ₹168 crore payoff from Man Utd over contract termination?
39.article_body: Cristiano Ronaldo didn't receive £17-million (₹168-crore) payoff from Manchester United despite his contract being terminated prematurely. United were confident they had strong legal grounds to sue for contract breach given "unauthorised and damaging" nature of Ronaldo's interview with Piers Morgan, The Telegraph reported. Ronaldo's team reportedly agreed for no compensation to avoid legal battle.

40.title: Europe names John McFall as world's first specially-abled astronaut
40.article_body: The European Space Agency on Wednesday named the first ever "parastronaut". The agency said it selected former British Paralympic sprinter John McFall as part of a new generation of 17 recruits picked for astronaut training. He'll take part in a feasibility study designed to allow ESA to assess conditions needed for people with disabilities to take part in future missions.

41.title: Bihar people in Maha were safe under MVA govt: Aaditya Thackeray
41.article_body: Shiv Sena (UBT) leader Aaditya Thackeray on Wednesday said people from Bihar were safe in Maharashtra under the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government. There were no incidents of violence against people of Bihar under the erstwhile government, the MLA claimed. Earlier in the day, he met Bihar CM Nitish Kumar. Maharashtra was ruled by the MVA government till June 29.

42.title: 450 Celtic coins stolen from German museum
42.article_body: As many as 450 Celtic coins, valued at millions of euros, were stolen from the Roman-Celtic Museum in Germany's Manching town, police said. The heist came to light on Tuesday after employees at the museum found a "showcase was broken". "The loss of the Celtic treasure is a disaster,'' said Markus Blume, Minister of Science and Arts, Bavaria.

43.title: Kanye showed porn, Kim's explicit video in meetings: Former Yeezy, Adidas staff
43.article_body: Rapper Kanye West played pornography, showed his sex tapes as well as explicit video and photos of her former wife Kim Kardashian to Yeezy and Adidas team members, Rolling Stone reported citing former employees. He even showed an intimate photograph of Kim in job interviews. Adidas Yeezy was a fashion collaboration between Kanye and Adidas which ended in October 2022.

44.title: Anupam shares pic with filmmakers as he celebrates 'successful 2022'
44.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher shared videos and pictures with filmmakers R Balki, Aanand L Rai, Luv Ranjan, Madhur Bhandarkar and Kabir Khan on Instagram as he celebrated his "success in the year 2022" and his film 'Uunchai'. "I am an ardent admirer of each one of you. This is the best gift one could ever ask for," Anupam captioned the post.

45.title: BJP publicising fake videos due to fear of losing MCD polls: Sisodia
45.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Wednesday criticised the BJP and claimed the party is publicising fake videos due to the fear of losing MCD elections. His comment comes after Delhi minister Satyendar Jain's videos from Tihar jail surfaced online. "Congress and BJP are demanding the resignation of Satyendar Jain, therefore AAP is seen on the backfoot regarding...[him]," Sisodia said.

46.title: Gangster Amar Naik's aide traced 23 yrs after jumping bail in Maha; held
46.article_body: Ravindra Dhole, an alleged gang member of late gangster Amar Naik, was arrested on Tuesday from Maharashtra's Pune, an officer said. Dhole, who was arrested in 1998 in connection with a dacoity case, had jumped bail in 1999. "We didn't have as much as his photograph as, at that point, photo records of all accused weren't maintained," police said.

47.title: Several injured as school bus overturns near Jharkhand-Bengal border
47.article_body: A school bus overturned near the Jharkhand-West Bengal border on Wednesday. The incident took place in the Bhalupahadi area of Bardhaman, ANI reported. Several children, who were injured in the accident, are currently being treated. Pictures of injured children have surfaced on social media.

48.title: FDI equity inflows drop 14% during April-September to $26.9 bn: DPIIT
48.article_body: Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) equity inflows into India contracted by 14% to $26.9 billion during April-September this fiscal, Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT) data showed. The inflows were $31.15 billion during the corresponding period of the previous year. During the first half of this fiscal, Singapore emerged as the top investor with $10 billion FDI.

49.title: Goldman Sachs expects Nifty50 to reach 20,500 by 2023-end
49.article_body: Goldman Sachs on Wednesday said that it expects Nifty50, the NSE's benchmark index, to reach 20,500 by end of 2023, implying about 12% price returns from current levels. It expects Nifty profits to grow 15% in 2023 and 2024. Goldman Sachs has forecast India's GDP growth to slow to 5.9% year-on-year in 2023 from 6.9% in 2022.

50.title: Genocide: Meghalaya ex-CM blames Assam Police for deaths in border clash
50.article_body: Ex-Meghalaya CM Mukul Sangma on Wednesday said Assam Police personnel had committed "genocide" by "killing unarmed villagers" in the recent border clash between Assam and Meghalaya. "The incident occurred well within the jurisdiction of the state of Meghalaya...Action must be taken against the culprits," he said. As many as six people, including a forest guard, were killed in the firing.

51.title: Man who cheated actor Annu Kapoor of ₹4.36 lakh in KYC fraud arrested
51.article_body: A 28-year-old man has been arrested from Mumbai's Andheri, almost two months after he allegedly cheated actor Annu Kapoor of ₹4.36 lakh under the pretext of updating his bank KYC details, police said. The accused, Ashish Paswan, is a native of Darbhanga in Bihar. He reportedly earns commission by helping people open bank accounts, an official said.

52.title: Centre deploys teams as measles cases surge in Ranchi, Ahmedabad
52.article_body: The Centre has deployed high-level teams to Ranchi, Ahmedabad and Malappuram amid an increase in the number of measles cases among children there. The Health Ministry said the teams will assist the state health authorities in investigating the outbreak. They will also facilitate operationalisation of requisite control and containment, it added.

53.title: Meta pauses AI bot Galactica demo after complaints of fake research
53.article_body: Facebook's parent company Meta shut down its artificial intelligence (AI) bot Galactica following complaints from users that it was faking research papers. Galactica was introduced as a bot that can "summarise academic literature, solve math problems, generate Wiki articles, write scientific code, annotate molecules and proteins, and more". The bot demo was shut two days after its launch.

54.title: There's no rift in party: K'taka Cong on reports of poll tickets row
54.article_body: Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar on Wednesday stated that there is no rift in the party, adding, "The entire Congress is united. We are one." He was commenting on reports about Congress leaders fighting over ticket distribution for the upcoming Karnataka Assembly elections. Shivakumar further stated that he is confident that people of Karnataka will vote in favour of Congress.

55.title: We can make a scooter in 40 secs with expanded capacity: Ather Co-founder
55.article_body: Ather Energy's Co-founder Swapnil Jain said company can produce around 1,200 scooters daily with the expanded capacity, and a vehicle takes 40 seconds to be made. Company has increased its production to 4.20 lakh vehicles per annum through its new plant in Hosur, Tamil Nadu. Company is targeting annual sales of 26,000 to 30,000 units by FY23 end, he added.

56.title: JD(S) open to CM from minority community if party comes to power: HDK
56.article_body: Janata Dal (Secular) leader HD Kumaraswamy has said the party is ready to accommodate a CM from the minority or backward communities if elected to power in the Karnataka Assembly elections next year. "Muslims are our own people...They are Kannadigas too...This is...about...addressing the issues of that community," he added. Kumaraswamy further said the party aims to win 123 Assembly seats.

57.title: Andhra CM Jagan Reddy calls Chandrababu Naidu 'backstabber'
57.article_body: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister YS Jagan Mohan Reddy called Telugu Desam Party President N Chandrababu Naidu a "backstabber". "If someone establishes his own party and comes to power on his own, he is called...a Jagan. If you usurp a political party and even the Chief Minister's chair from your father-in-law...such a person is called Chandrababu," he added.

58.title: Actress Aindrila's sister shares post after her death, says 'Without you, I'm crippled'
58.article_body: Bengali actress Aindrila Sharma's sister Aishwarya Sharma penned a note following her demise. "Without you I am crippled...Who will dress me up ? Who will take my picture ? Who will understand the unspoken words from my mouth?" she wrote. "In these 24 years, I have not learnt to do anything on my own sister," her post read.

59.title: Law & order deteriorated under DMK rule: AIADMK's EPS to TN Governor
59.article_body: AIADMK leader Edappadi K Palaniswami on Wednesday met Tamil Nadu Governor RN Ravi at Raj Bhavan in Chennai and said the law and order situation has deteriorated under DMK rule in the last 18 months. EPS said that despite warnings from central intelligence agencies, the state government had not taken measures to prevent the Coimbatore blast on October 23.

60.title: Daughter Sara reminds me to be humble in interactions: Saif Ali Khan
60.article_body: Actor Saif Ali Khan has said that his daughter and actress Sara Ali Khan keeps reminding him to be humble in interactions. "Sara doesn't like offending people or acting smart with people who act smart. She has a calm...polite way, ego doesn't get in the way," he added. Saif stated his son Ibrahim is a "fun and chill guy".

61.title: Kirti was into herself during shoot of 'Four...' season 3: Maanvi
61.article_body: Actress Maanvi Gagroo has reacted to her 'Four More Shots Please!' co-star Kirti Kulhari's statement where she said that she is not that close to co-stars Maanvi, Sayani Gupta and Bani J. "In this season, Kirti was very much into herself. She preferred spending a lot of time alone and we girls totally respected that," Maanvi stated.

62.title: AIIMS Delhi server down for 15 hours due to suspected cyberattack
62.article_body: AIIMS Delhi on Wednesday said the hospital's server has been down for 15 hours, resulting in digital services like smart lab, billing and report generation of outpatient and inpatient departments getting affected. "National Informatics Centre team...has informed that this may be a ransomware attack," AIIMS said. The hospital's registration process is being handled manually and is causing delays.

63.title: Bhumi Pednekar took my first audition, she has midas touch: Kiara
63.article_body: Actress Kiara Advani, while promoting 'Govinda Naam Mera' with Bhumi Pednekar and Vicky Kaushal, revealed that Bhumi took her very first audition. Reacting to this, Vicky stated Bhumi took his audition too. Describing the audition, Kiara said, "It was not for anything. You just have to go and audition...they'll find a film." Kiara added Bhumi has the "midas touch".

64.title: IAS officer shares society notice asking delivery workers to not use lift, people react
64.article_body: IAS officer Awanish Sharan shared an undated photo of a notice pasted outside a lift entrance. It states that only residents are allowed to use the lift and others, including delivery workers, shouldn't use it. "Can you deliver the food or delivery bag to...20th floor by using staircase?" a person commented while another Twitter user called it "class divide".

65.title: Saudi Arabia player reveals he screamed 'You will not win' at Messi in viral video
65.article_body: Saudi Arabia defender Ali Al-Bulayhi has revealed what he screamed at Lionel Messi during his side's 2-1 victory over Argentina in their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener on Tuesday. After a video showing Al-Bulayhi shouting something at Messi after Saudi Arabia scored their second goal went viral, the defender revealed he was saying, "You will not win...you will not win!"

66.title: Ravindra Jadeja ruled out of ODI series against Bangladesh
66.article_body: Team India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja has been ruled out of the upcoming ODI series against Bangladesh. The BCCI, in a statement, said that Jadeja is yet to recover from his knee injury and he will continue to be under the supervision of the BCCI's medical team. Jadeja had also missed the T20 World Cup 2022 due to the injury.

67.title: I never got a call from them: Manish Pandey on LSG releasing him
67.article_body: Reacting to being released by Lucknow Super Giants ahead of IPL 2023, batter Manish Pandey said, "I never got a call [from them]." He added, "I just got to know about it on the day the list was announced. There was no real communication." He further said, "They wanted to release me and get some extra money."

68.title: Starbucks awarded ₹13 lakh in case against Jaipur cafe over 'Frappuccino'
68.article_body: Delhi High Court has awarded over ₹13 lakh to US-based coffee chain Starbucks in its lawsuit against a Jaipur cafe for trademark infringement. The court permanently restrained the cafe from using Starbucks' registered 'Frappuccino' trademark to sell its products. "The adoption of the 'Frappuccino' mark by the Jaipur cafe is dishonest and intended to deceive unwary consumers," the court said.

69.title: India to export further 2-4 mn tonnes of sugar this season: Industry body
69.article_body: India is likely to allow a further 2-4 million tonnes of sugar exports in 2022/23 season, Indian Sugar Mills Association (ISMA) said. ISMA President Aditya Jhunjhunwala said India would likely produce 36 million tonnes of sugar. India consumes around 27-27.5 million tonnes, leaving 8.5-9 million tonnes for export, he said. Government has already approved sugar export of 6 million tonnes.

70.title: Wipro becomes 1st Indian IT company to allow employees to form union in Europe
70.article_body: Wipro has become the first Indian IT services company to allow its employees to unionise in Europe. The company has entered into an agreement with employee representatives to set up a European Works Council (EWC) following a request by employees in 2019. The employees belong to 13 countries including France, Sweden, Finland and Germany.

71.title: I-T dept raids 40 locations related to oil & pulses traders in TN
71.article_body: Income Tax Department on Wednesday conducted searches at 40 locations of five major suppliers of pulses and palm oil to Public Distribution System shops in Tamil Nadu. "We found that proper accounts weren't maintained by these companies...We also suspect that there's been tax evasion," said a senior I-T official. The searches are reportedly expected to continue for a few days.

72.title: Tax collection to exceed budget estimate by ₹4 lakh cr: Revenue Secretary
72.article_body: India's tax collection will exceed the total budget estimate of ₹27.50 lakh crore by nearly ₹4 lakh crore in the current fiscal, Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj said. Bajaj said the direct tax collection comprising personal and corporate taxes would be about ₹17.50 lakh crore this year. Collection from indirect taxes, customs, excise and GST, would be nearly ₹14 lakh crore.

73.title: CEC can't be weak, should be able to take action against PM: SC
73.article_body: The Supreme Court said the country needs a Chief Election Commissioner (CEC) who isn't weak-kneed and can take action against the Prime Minister, if needed. "The CEC is supposed to be insulated from political influence and should be independent," the top court said. Yesterday, the Supreme Court said that CEC of strong character like late TN Seshan is needed.

74.title: Assam govt demands CBI probe in border firing incident
74.article_body: Assam Minister Jayanta Mallabaruah said that the state government has requested the central government to order a probe by the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) into the firing incident along the Assam-Meghalaya border. The incident which killed five people from Meghalaya and one Assam Forest Guard happened on Tuesday. The Assam Congress alleged that the firing was a "deliberate incident".

75.title: Polygraph test postponed as Aftab falls sick, likely to take place tomorrow
75.article_body: The polygraph test that Aftab Poonawala was supposed to undergo on Wednesday has been cancelled as he has fallen sick. According to reports, this could affect the results of the test, because of which the test is likely to take place tomorrow. Shraddha, in a complaint that she filed in 2020, had said that Aftab had threatened to kill her.

76.title: Shocked: SP MLA Rais Shaikh after visiting municipal school in Bhiwandi
76.article_body: Samajwadi Party MLA Rais Shaikh said he was shocked to see state of school run by Thane Municipal Corporation (TMC) after he visited one in Maharashtra's Bhiwandi. "It's been 75 years since independence but we still haven't been able to provide desks and benches to our children?" Shaikh tweeted. "I sat with the students on the floor," he added.

77.title: Kumaraswamy apologises as viral video shows him abusing Congress MLA
77.article_body: JD(S) leader HD Kumaraswamy apologised on Wednesday after a video of him using abusive language against Congress MLA KR Ramesh Kumar went viral. "I regret if my word has hurt...Kumar," the ex-Karnataka CM said. He claimed he had uttered an expletive as he was sad to see the poor condition of a government school in Srinivaspur. Kumar represents Srinivaspur constituency.

78.title: 6 killed in US' Virginia as Walmart manager opens fire at employees
78.article_body: A Walmart manager shot dead six fellow employees and wounded several others at a store in the US' Virginia state on Tuesday night, authorities said on Wednesday. The suspected gunman reportedly fatally shot himself before the police found him. So far, no clear motive has been found behind the shooting.

79.title: Military will crush attempts at regime change: Sri Lankan Prez
79.article_body: Sri Lankan President Ranil Wickremesinghe said on Wednesday he will use the military to crush any future anti-government protests in the country that aim at regime change. He further rejected the Opposition's demand for early elections, saying the Parliament will not be dissolved till the ongoing economic crisis is resolved. Wickremesinghe's current mandate as president is till November 2024.

80.title: Pak PM Sharif to appoint next Army chief; receives list of candidates
80.article_body: Pakistani Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif is set to appoint the country's next Army chief after the military submitted a list of six senior Army generals as candidates. "The prime minister will take a decision on the appointments as per the laid down procedure," the Prime Minister's Office said. Incumbent Army chief General Qamar Bajwa will retire on November 29.

81.title: Travellers with single name on Indian passports not allowed to travel to UAE
81.article_body: Passengers with a single name on Indian passports on tourist, visitor or other visas won't be allowed to travel to and from UAE. Both first and last names are required on passports. Travel will be allowed to passengers with a single name with a residence permit or employment visa, provided the same name is in 'First Name' and 'Surname' columns.

82.title: Sena's Aaditya Thackeray meets Nitish Kumar, Tejashwi Yadav in Patna
82.article_body: Shiv Sena (Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray) leader Aaditya Thackeray, along with party MP Priyanka Chaturvedi, met Bihar CM Nitish Kumar and Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav in Patna on Wednesday. "We've been in touch with each other but could not meet due to COVID-19...Sure this friendship will continue," Aaditya said. "The current challenge is to save the law and...democracy," Tejashwi Yadav said.

83.title: Dislocated both shoulders while filming 'Kantara': Rishab Shetty
83.article_body: Actor Rishab Shetty revealed that he dislocated both his shoulders while filming 'Kantara', however, he continued the shoot. "While rehearsing for the pre-climax, I began having issues with my shoulder. During a 360-degree shot, I dislocated one shoulder. On the very next day, I dislocated my other shoulder as well during shooting," he added. Rishab also directed and wrote 'Kantara'.

84.title: Andhra CM equates self with NTR, calls Chandrababu Naidu 'Ravana'
84.article_body: Andhra Pradesh CM Jagan Mohan Reddy on Wednesday equated himself with former CM NT Rama Rao (NTR). He said, "If someone establishes his own party and comes to power on his own, he is called...NTR or...Jagan." Further, he called TDP MLA Chandrababu Naidu "Ravana". Reddy said Naidu had seized the Chief Minister's chair from NTR, who was his father-in-law.

85.title: AAP's Raghav Chadha uses dialogue from 'Sholay' during rally in Guj
85.article_body: AAP leader Raghav Chadha used a dialogue from 'Sholay' to state the effect Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's presence has had on corrupt people. "Today, when any corrupt man cries within miles of Gujarat, his mother tells him, 'So ja beta warna Kejriwal aa jayega'," Chadha said. Kejriwal was born to end corruption and curb rising prices, he added.

86.title: If BJP fails in horse-trading attempts, it uses agencies to harass leaders: TRS MLC
86.article_body: TRS MLC K Kavitha on Wednesday criticised the BJP and said if the party fails in horse-trading attempts, it uses central agencies to harass leaders of opposition parties. "The only policy that BJP preaches is 'Ram-Ram Japna, Paraya Leader Apna'," she said. Addressing TRS members in Yellareddy, she asked why BJP is evading SIT probe if they did nothing wrong.

87.title: Madras HC imposes ₹35,000 fine on 2 people for fake allegations against police
87.article_body: Madras HC has reportedly imposed a fine of ₹35,000 on two petitioners who made fake allegations against police personnel. The amount will be distributed equally among seven police officials, against whom the petitioners had sought to initiate disciplinary action. The concerned police officials had earlier initiated action against the petitioners for running an orphanage illegally.

88.title: 24th-ranked Japan defeat 4-time champions Germany in 2022 FIFA World Cup
88.article_body: Japan, who are the 24th ranked team in the world, defeated four-time champions Germany 2-1 in their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener on Wednesday. Germany's İlkay Gündoğan opened the scoring in the match by converting a penalty in the 33rd minute. Ritsu Doan equalised in the 75th minute, before Takuma Asano netted the winner in the 83rd minute.

89.title: Disha Salian's case was not with us, how can we conclude it: CBI
89.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) on Wednesday dismissed news reports stating that the agency has concluded Disha Salian's death case as an accident. "The Disha case was not with us, so how can we conclude anything?" a CBI official told Free Press Journal. "Moreover, the HC already rejected a PIL seeking a CBI probe into Disha's case," he added.

90.title: Kanye West says he will run for 2024 US Presidential elections
90.article_body: In a video posted by a Twitter account, Kanye West was asked if he'll be running for the 2024 US Presidential elections. To this, Kanye replied, "Yes...It's simple...It's just we're moving toward the future." Kanye took to Twitter and wrote, "What [do] you guys think [Donald Trump's] response was when I asked him to be my running mate in 2024?"

91.title: Google to restore parliament's YouTube or pay 1 bn rubles: Russia
91.article_body: A Russian court ordered Google to restore the YouTube channel of the State Duma, Russia's parliament, or pay a fine of 100 thousand rubles per day until it reaches 1 billion rubles, the Duma said. The parliament also asked Google to not treat the Duma like they did US President Donald Trump and cut off all its communication.

92.title: Told Leonardo 'You'll give screen test or you're out': Cameron on Titanic
92.article_body: Filmmaker James Cameron revealed actor Leonardo DiCaprio nearly lost his role in 'Titanic' during the film's screen test. DiCaprio said that he doesn't give screen tests, to which, Cameron told him, "You're going to read, or you're not going to get the part." Later, Leonardo did give the screen test and Cameron cast him as Jack in the film.

93.title: Ex-Odisha minister Golak Bihari passes away; President condoles death
93.article_body: Former Odisha minister Golak Bihari Naik passed away at a private nursing home on Wednesday. The former Udala MLA began his political career with the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) and later joined the Biju Janata Dal (BJD). The leader was aged above 60. Condoling his demise, President Droupadi Murmu said, "In his death, we have lost an affable people's leader."

94.title: Indians without full name on passports will be barred from entering UAE
94.article_body: Indians who don't have their full name on their passports won't be allowed to fly to or out of UAE, according to new rules which came into effect on Monday. Passengers travelling to UAE on residential or employment visas are, however, exempted from the rule. "We're...awaiting information from the embassy [on this]," a UAE-based travel agency told Khaleej Times.

95.title: 4 mobiles, 2 battery chargers recovered inside Punjab's Kapurthala jail
95.article_body: Four mobile phones and two battery chargers were recovered from Punjab's Kapurthala Central Jail's high-security zone after a surprise check on Wednesday, officials said. Jail Superintendent Iqbal Singh Dhaliwal said the administration has been conducting surprise checks to check the use of mobile phones. He added that they've written to Kapurthala Kotwali Police Station for further action.

96.title: Assets of 9 major ports being considered for monetisation: MoS for Ports
96.article_body: Union Minister Shantanu Thakur, addressing the PM Gati Shakti Multimodal Maritime Summit 2022, said assets of nine major ports are considered for monetisation between FY22-25 under National Monetisation Programme, according to a FICCI release. He added that development of 11 industrial corridors and two defence industrial corridors is planned to improve operational efficiency of existing assets.

97.title: Germany players cover mouths for World Cup photo to protest pro-LGBTQ armband ban
97.article_body: Germany players covered their mouths with hands during team photo before their 2022 FIFA World Cup Group E encounter against Japan to protest pro-LGBTQ 'OneLove' armband ban. Earlier, seven European captains decided not to wear the armbands after FIFA stated they'll receive a yellow card if they do so. FIFA had also warned of sanctions against teams over the armband.

98.title: Coinbase holds 2 mn Bitcoin: CEO after Binance CEO questions its holdings
98.article_body: Cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase's CEO Brian Armstrong said that the company holds around 2 million Bitcoin worth $39.9 billion as of September 30, 2022. "If you see FUD (fear, uncertainty and doubt) out there - remember, our financials are public," Armstrong tweeted. This comes after Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao's tweet that questioned Coinbase's Bitcoin holdings, which has now been deleted.

99.title: Russia's Gazprom threatens to cut gas supply to Europe through Ukraine
99.article_body: Gazprom has threatened to reduce natural gas supplies through the last pipeline heading to Europe via Ukraine, claiming the amount it supplies for Moldova is not reaching the country. Gazprom said Moldova's Moldovagaz has paid for part of its November gas flows under its contract. Ukraine dismissed the claims, saying all supplies that Russia sent were "fully transferred" to Moldova.

100.title: Bidders for bankrupt Reliance Capital seek extension for bidding deadline
100.article_body: Multiple companies have written to the Reliance Capital Administrator for an extension for submitting binding bids for Anil Ambani's company, claiming they need more time to finalise the resolution plan. Oaktree and Torrent have requested to extend the deadline from November 28 to December 16. Piramal and Zurich have asked for the deadline to be pushed back to December 23.

101.title: Principal found sleeping in classroom after allegedly getting drunk in Maharashtra
101.article_body: A school principal was found sleeping inside a classroom after allegedly getting drunk in Maharashtra's Amravati. A video showing the principal sleeping on the floor of the classroom wearing a vest has surfaced online. Several social media users called for action against the principal.

102.title: Indian banks outstanding, international banks terribly run: Nikhil Kamath
102.article_body: Zerodha Co-founder Nikhil Kamath on Tuesday thanked PMO, Reserve Bank of India and Infosys Co-founder Nandan Nilekani for creating the current banking ecosystem. "Indian banks are outstanding, can't believe how terribly run international banks are," Kamath tweeted. Kamath added, "How in today's day and age can it take days to do a simple bank transfer, and cost so much?"

103.title: Students in Bengal clash over saffron scarves, hijab; school postpones exams
103.article_body: A clash broke out between two groups of students in Sankrail in West Bengal's Howrah on Tuesday after a group of five students demanded they be allowed to enter while wearing saffron scarves. The students made the demand in response to authorities' permission to allow girls to wear hijab. The authorities later cancelled scheduled exams in the school, including pre-boards.

104.title: Air India facing pilot, crew shortage amid international expansion: Report
104.article_body: Air India is facing a severe crunch in trained and experienced pilots to cater to its international expansion drive, CNBC-TV18 reported. The report added that Air India needs around 200 senior pilots to operate the recently announced 20 new weekly flights for Birmingham, London and San Francisco. The airline requires around 900-1,000 additional crew to operate on the new flights.

105.title: Adani Group in talks to raise $5 bn as banks urge to reduce debt: Report
105.article_body: The Adani Group is planning to raise roughly $5 billion after lenders asked the group to reduce leverage, Bloomberg reported citing people familiar with the matter. The group has reached out to firms including Mubadala Investment Company and Abu Dhabi Investment Authority about investments. The fundraising would include the funds raised in the potential Adani Enterprises share issue.

106.title: India to start free trade agreement negotiations with GCC on Thursday
106.article_body: India and the Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC) will announce the launch of negotiations for a free trade agreement on Thursday, an official said. India's exports to the GCC member countries grew by 58.26% to about $44 billion in 2021-22, Commerce Ministry data showed. Notably, GCC comprises of six Gulf countries including Saudi Arabia, UAE, Qatar, Kuwait, Oman and Bahrain.

107.title: Which are the world's most expensive places for luxury shopping?
107.article_body: Manhattan's Upper 5th Avenue is the world's priciest street globally for luxury shopping with annual shop rents averaging $2,000 (over ₹1.6 lakh) per sq ft, according to a survey by commercial property firm Cushman & Wakefield. Hong Kong's Tsim Sha Tsui is the second-priciest, followed by Italy's Via Montenapoleone. Hong Kong's Causeway Bay had topped the ranking pre-COVID-19.

108.title: EU considers imposing price cap of $65-$70 on Russian oil: Report
108.article_body: The European Union, in coordination with the Group of Seven nations, is discussing capping the price of Russian crude oil at between $65 and $70 a barrel, Bloomberg reported. The price cap could be announced later on Wednesday after a meeting of EU ambassadors. EU has also proposed adding a number of grace periods to its cap legislation.

109.title: School timings in Haryana revised from Dec 1 over drop in temperature
109.article_body: Haryana government has announced that school timings have been revised with effect from December 1 over a drop in temperature. For schools taking classes in a single shift, the timings are 9:30 am-3:30 pm, while timings for schools taking classes in two shifts are 7:55 am-12:30 pm and 12:40 pm-5:15 pm. Timings for teachers and other staff remain unchanged.

110.title: Shraddha would’ve been alive if police had taken action, says father
110.article_body: Shraddha Walkar's father on Wednesday said that his daughter would've been alive if police had taken action against Aftab Poonawala based on the letter she had written in 2020. Shraddha submitted a written complaint to the Tulinj Police Station on November 23, 2020, alleging that Aftab had threatened to "kill her and cut her into pieces".

111.title: Nearly 100 huts, shops destroyed in fire in Assam's Karbi Anglong
111.article_body: Nearly 100 huts and shops were destroyed in a fire that broke out at Lahorijan in Assam's Karbi Anglong district near the Nagaland border on Wednesday, officials said. No injuries were reported in the fire. Police said that several cylinders burst in the fire, adding that one four-wheeler and three motorcycles were also damaged during the incident.

112.title: CBI sentences 10 people to imprisonment for bank fraud in 2013 in Hyd
112.article_body: The Special Judge for Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) cases in Hyderabad sentenced 10 people to various periods of rigorous imprisonment for involvement in bank fraud in 2013. In March 2013, the CBI registered a case against the accused for bank fraud and causing losses of over ₹4 crore to Bank of Maharashtra. A fine was also imposed on them.

113.title: Satyendar Jain to get food as per his religious beliefs in jail, says Delhi court
113.article_body: Approving AAP leader Satyendar Jain's request for "proper food", a Delhi court ordered Tihar administration to provide him with food as per his religious beliefs. Jain had complained that he was deprived of proper food in jail. As per Jain's lawyer, he eats food only after going to temple and has been eating only fruits ever since he was jailed.

114.title: Law & order in Raj has deteriorated under Ashok Gehlot regime: Thakur
114.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Wednesday criticised the Congress government in Rajasthan and alleged that the state has witnessed a deterioration in law and order under the Ashok Gehlot regime. Speaking to reporters in Jaipur, he said, "Everyday, some or the other news is coming from Rajasthan, be it about crimes against women or atrocities against...Dalits."

115.title: Cricketers openly doing politics, says AAP on Rivaba using Jadeja's pic
115.article_body: Responding to BJP candidate Rivaba Jadeja using her husband and Indian cricketer Ravindra Jadeja's image in her campaign posters, AAP MLA Naresh Balyan said that cricketers are now "openly doing politics". Congress candidate and Ravindra Jadeja's sister, Naynaba Jadeja, accused Rivaba of using children to gain sympathy. "In a way, it is called child labour," she said.

116.title: UK Supreme Court rules against Scottish independence vote
116.article_body: The UK Supreme Court on Wednesday ruled that Scotland does not have the power to conduct a fresh referendum on independence without the British government's assent. This is a setback for the semi-autonomous Scottish government, which wanted to hold an independence referendum next year. The British government has so far refused to approve the referendum plan.

117.title: Guv Koshyari wants to leave Maha: Ajit Pawar amid Shivaji remark row
117.article_body: NCP leader Ajit Pawar has claimed that Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari had expressed his desire to leave the state and be relieved from his post. "I...asked [Koshyari] to convey this to his seniors so that they consider his wish," he added. Pawar's remarks come after Koshyari's recent remark where he called Shivaji Maharaj an "icon of olden times".

118.title: 'Tantrik' pours 50 tubes of superglue on naked couple in Rajasthan forest, kills them
118.article_body: A 'tantrik' was arrested in Udaipur for killing a couple known to him after pouring 50 superglue tubes on their naked bodies in a forest. The victims, who were married to other people, were having an affair. The 'tantrik' told the man's wife about it. When the two found out, they conspired to defame him, after which he murdered them.

119.title: Sridevi's mom asked for ₹10 lakh for film, I said I'll pay ₹11 lakh: Boney
119.article_body: Producer Boney Kapoor recalled an incident where his wife Sridevi's mother had asked for ₹10 lakh fee on behalf of the late actress for a film. "I said I'll pay ₹11 lakh...I put a condition that the next film [Sridevi] signs, cannot be less than ₹15 lakh," the producer stated. He added that Sridevi was paid ₹15 lakh for 'Chandni'.

120.title: 30-year-old bike rider dies after getting hit by DJB truck
120.article_body: A 30-year-old motorbike-borne died after being hit by a Delhi Jal Board (DJB) truck in the Mangolpuri area, police said. According to reports, the truck, which is believed to be involved in the accident, was intercepted, but the accused escaped from the spot. CCTV footage is being scanned to establish the sequence of events, said a senior police official.

121.title: Brazilian influencer gets Elon Musk's name tattooed on forehead; pics surface
121.article_body: A Brazilian influencer named Rodrigo America, who considers the world's richest man Elon Musk his idol, has got the entrepreneur's name tattooed on his forehead. "What he's doing, what he's going to do, taking human beings to Mars, his name will go down in history," Rodrigo said about Musk. Rodrigo also has a rocket tattooed on his forehead.

122.title: After 16 years, CHB teachers get hike from ₹60 to ₹150 per hr in Maha
122.article_body: After 16 years, the Maharashtra government has increased the remuneration of clock-hour basis (CHB) teachers employed at higher secondary private schools from ₹60 per hour to ₹150 per hour. Meanwhile, CHB teachers of secondary private schools will now get ₹120 per hour. Unhappy with the hike, a teacher said, "With such meagre remuneration, it's very difficult to sustain in [Pune]."

123.title: Price of certain liquor to go up in Kerala as cabinet approves 4% increase in GST
123.article_body: Indian-made foreign liquor (IMFL) in Kerala will become costlier as the state cabinet on Wednesday approved a 4% increase in general sales tax (GST). Earlier in June, the state government had hinted at the possibility of a rise in IMFL rates after cost of raw materials increased. The liquor manufacturers have also been urging the government to increase the prices.

124.title: Kyiv residents to experience 'worst winter since WWII': Mayor
124.article_body: Kyiv's Mayor Vitali Klitschko said the 3 million inhabitants of the Ukrainian capital are set to experience one of the toughest winters in recent times due to Russian shelling on the city's infrastructure. "This is the worst winter since World War II," German newspaper Bild quoted Klitschko as saying. In the "worst case scenario", residents may be evacuated, he said.

125.title: Ex-superintendent of Pune orphanage jailed over allowing child marriage
125.article_body: A local court in Maharashtra has sentenced the ex-superintendent of a government-run orphanage in Pune's Baramati to one month in jail and levied a fine of ₹52,000 on her over a child marriage held there in 2014. Lata Vasantrao Rathod was found guilty under Section 11(1) of the Prohibition of Child Marriage Act and Section 506 (criminal intimidation) of IPC.

126.title: Search efforts continue after Indonesian quake, toll rises to 268
126.article_body: Over 12,000 Indonesian Army personnel were deployed on Wednesday to expedite search operations following the deadly earthquake that struck the country's main island of Java on Monday. Chief of National Disaster Mitigation Agency Suharyanto said so far 268 bodies have been recovered and at least 151 people are still missing. Nearly 600 people are receiving treatment for serious injuries.

127.title: Even Lalit Pandit's kids don't talk to me: Jatin Pandit
127.article_body: Music composer Jatin Pandit, speaking about his equation with his brother and music composer Lalit Pandit, has said that Lalit's children also don't talk to him. "I have told this 100 times. I am always ready. But it has to happen from both sides. But I have stopped saying anymore because I was refused so many times," he added.

128.title: 5.9-magnitude quake hits northwest Turkey, no major damage reported
128.article_body: An earthquake of 5.9 magnitude struck Duzce province in northwestern Turkey on Wednesday morning, said the country's Disaster and Emergency Management Presidency. No death or major damage was reported. The quake was followed by 35 aftershocks. Interior Minister Suleyman Soylu said at least 50 people were hospitalised with injuries. One of the injured is in critical condition.

129.title: Fawad Khan's Legend of Maula Jatt earns PKR 200 cr worldwide: Report
129.article_body: Pakistani film 'The Legend of Maula Jatt' has reportedly earned around PKR 200 crore worldwide. As per reports, the film collected PKR 80 crore domestically and PKR 120 crore from the overseas market. The film has also become the highest-earning Pakistani film to date. 'The Legend of Maula Jatt' featured Fawad Khan and Mahira Khan.

130.title: Drinking even less alcohol during pregnancy alters baby’s brain: Study
130.article_body: Drinking even less amount of alcohol during pregnancy can alter baby's brain structure and development, a new study stated. Researchers found that the right superior temporal sulcus (STS), a brain region involved in social cognition, audiovisual integration and language perception in the foetus exposed to alcohol, was shallower. STS has a great influence on language development during childhood.

131.title: Mangaluru blast case to be formally handed over to NIA: K'taka DGP
131.article_body: Karnataka DGP Praveen Sood on Wednesday said the Mangaluru autorickshaw blast case will be formally handed over to the National Investigation Agency (NIA) soon. Sood, along with Home Minister Araga Jnanendra, inspected the blast spot on the outskirts of Mangaluru and later held a meeting. Jnanendra said the accused had visited different places like Coimbatore and Kanniyakumari in Tamil Nadu.

132.title: 16-yr-old girl mowed down by bus after falling from scooter in Bengaluru
132.article_body: A 16-year-old girl was mowed down by a BMTC bus in Bengaluru after getting knocked off her mother's scooter on Tuesday. The bus reportedly swerved to the right and knocked down their scooter, following which the victim, Layashri, her brother, Yashwin, and their mother, Priyadarshini, fell to the side. Layashri and Yashwin were on their way to their school.

133.title: Russia declared a state sponsor of terrorism by European Parliament
133.article_body: The European Parliament on Wednesday designated Russia as a state sponsor of terrorism. It argued that Moscow's military strikes on civilian targets such as energy infrastructure, hospitals, schools and shelters violated international law. The move is largely symbolic, as the European Union does not have a legal framework in place to back it up.

134.title: Am I doing hawala business: T'gana Minister Malla Reddy after IT raids
134.article_body: A day after the Income Tax department conducted raids at the properties belonging to Telangana Labour Minister Malla Reddy and his son-in-law in Secunderabad, the Minister accused the BJP of creating terror. "Am I doing hawala business?" he asked. "BJP and Modi government are deploying IT officers to 50 different places and houses to create terror," Reddy said.

135.title: Congress model means corruption, nepotism, it has ruined Guj & India: PM Modi
135.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday accused Congress of indulging in vote bank politics and creating rifts between people of different castes and districts to be in power. "Congress model means corruption, nepotism...and casteism," he said. "This model has ruined not just Gujarat but also India. This is...why we've to try hard today to take the country ahead," he added.

136.title: Country-made bomb explodes near bus stop in Telangana's Siddipet
136.article_body: A country-made bomb exploded near the Husnabad RTC bus stand in Telangana's Siddipet on Tuesday, but no injuries were reported in the incident. According to the police, the bomb exploded around 9:45 am, when a fruit vendor ran his cart over it. Police later discovered five such bombs in the bushes near the bus stop and are investigating the case.

137.title: IMD predicts heavy rains in B'luru, other parts of Karnataka till Nov 24
137.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted heavy rainfall till November 24 in Bengaluru. Showers are also expected in Karnataka's coastal districts of Udupi, Dakshina Kannada and Uttara Kannada, along with the hilly regions of Shivamogga, Kodagu and Hassan. Bengaluru on Monday reported a minimum temperature of 13.9°C, the lowest temperature recorded in the city in November in a decade.

138.title: Dubai's 100-storey 'hypertower' to be the world's tallest residential building
138.article_body: Plans have been unveiled to build a 100-storey 'hypertower' in Dubai, which the developers claim will be the world's tallest residential building. Named 'Burj Binghatti Jacob & Co Residences', the hypertower will have diamond-shaped spires at the top to resemble a crown. The building will house a dedicated concierge team, offering services such as daycare, bodyguard, chauffeur and private chef.

139.title: It is dead: Lionel Messi on Argentina's morale after losing to Saudi Arabia
139.article_body: On being asked about the team's morale after losing to Saudi Arabia 1-2 in their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener, Argentina captain Lionel Messi said, "The truth? Dead." He added, "It is a very hard blow because we did not expect to start in this way." He further said, "We've to prepare for what is coming, we've to win."

140.title: Doesn't matter what people say: Hardik on criticism over Samson, Umran's non-selection
140.article_body: Referring to criticism over not selecting Umran Malik and Sanju Samson in the playing XI in the recently concluded T20I series against New Zealand, Hardik Pandya said, "Doesn't matter what people say." He added, "This is my team and I will pick the best side after discussing with the coach." He further stated that everyone will get their chances.

141.title: Cristiano Ronaldo fined ₹50 lakh for smashing young fan's phone
141.article_body: Portugal captain Cristiano Ronaldo has been fined £50,000 (₹50 lakh) and handed a two-match suspension by Football Association (FA) for smashing a young fan's phone following Manchester United's defeat against Everton at Goodison Park in April. Manchester United on Tuesday terminated Ronaldo's contract by mutual consent following his interview with Piers Morgan, wherein he had criticised the club.

142.title: Farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal's fast enters fifth day
142.article_body: Bharti Kisan Union (Ekta Sidhupur) President Jagjit Singh Dallewal's fast entered its fifth day on Wednesday. Dallewal has pledged to fast unto death till the Punjab government agrees to various demands of the farmers, including cancellation of cases against farmers for burning paddy residue. "Even if I die, I appeal to [farmers] to carry out their protests [peacefully]," he said.

143.title: BBL doesn't have enough money to buy Suryakumar Yadav: Glenn Maxwell
143.article_body: Praising world number one T20I batter Suryakumar Yadav, Australia all-rounder Glenn Maxwell said, "He is frustratingly consistent. Yadav is so much better than everyone else." He added, "[BBL] doesn't have enough money...to buy Suryakumar Yadav. Cricket Australia will have to sack every player, even the centrally contracted ones to gather the money and hope that he agrees [to play BBL]."

144.title: No scene happened: Dalip on Jaya Prada slapping him during rape scene
144.article_body: Actor Dalip Tahil has said that he still reads reports about him getting slapped by actress Jaya Prada after he lost control during a rape scene. Refuting such reports, he stated, "Let me clarify...I have never shared screen space with Jaya Prada ji. I was keen to do so but never got the chance. No such scene ever happened."

145.title: It hurts when good music doesn't work with audience: Amit Trivedi
145.article_body: Music composer Amit Trivedi said that he was "hurt" and "depressed" when audience rejected the music of 'Bombay Velvet', 'Luv Shuv Tey Chicken Khurana' and other films. "They were so good. I thought they'd work. But people didn't understand," he shared. The musician expressed that he has accepted and understood that audience's reaction to his music isn't in his control.

146.title: Bengaluru-based tech companies raised record $7.5 bn in 2022: Report
146.article_body: Bengaluru-based tech companies have raised a record $7.5 billion in venture capital funding in the first three quarters of 2022, according to a report from London & Partners in partnership with Dealroom. Bengaluru features among the top 10 cities globally for most investments in last five years. Bengaluru is attracting more investments than Singapore, Paris and Berlin, the report mentioned.

147.title: Want to know if there was 'hanky panky': SC to govt on EC Arun Goel's appointment
147.article_body: The Supreme Court asked the Centre on Wednesday to produce before it the file related to the appointment of Election Commissioner Arun Goel. A five-judge Constitution bench said it wants to know whether there was any "hanky panky" in Goel's appointment as Election Commissioner. The court raised questions as Goel was recently given retirement from service.

148.title: Wasn't giving me the joy I wanted: Parvathy on not doing Hindi films
148.article_body: Actress Parvathy Thiruvothu said that after 'Qarib Qarib Singlle', Bollywood offered her same sort of roles. "It wasn't giving me the joy that I wanted," she said, adding that the Malayalam film industry was giving her different characters, concepts and genres. However, she said she'd soon announce a Hindi project in which she'd be seen in a supporting role.

149.title: Musk names South Korea among top options for EV factory in Asia
149.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said that South Korea is among its top candidate locations to build an electric vehicles (EVs) factory in Asia, South Korean presidential office said. During a video call with President Yoon Suk Yeol, Musk said he would make the decision on EVs factory after reviewing investment conditions in other countries, including labour, technology and infrastructure.

150.title: Dutch investor Prosus values its 9.67% Byju's stake at $578 mn
150.article_body: Netherlands-based investor Prosus valued its 9.67% stake in Byju's at $578 million by the end of the September quarter. The private investor also valued Byju's at $5.97 billion and identified the edtech unicorn as a non-controlling financial investment. In its 2022 annual report, Prosus said that it had invested a total of $536 million in Byju's.

151.title: Satyendar Jain claims video of eating food in Tihar jail is doctored
151.article_body: Delhi minister Satyendar Jain's lawyers have claimed that the latest leaked video, which shows the AAP leader eating food inside his cell at Tihar jail, was based on doctored clips. Jain's lawyers told the court that the leaked video was from September and comprised tapes from different dates. The ED had the video, said Advocate Abhijit Shankar, representing Tihar jail.

152.title: Mumbai man sheds 10 kg in 2 months to donate part of liver to son
152.article_body: A Mumbai man, who weighed 86 kg, lost 10 kg in two months to donate part of his liver to his two-year-old son. After working out and following a strict diet plan, Yogesh Vaze got ready for the surgery. His son, born with a rare condition called Progressive Familial Intrahepatic Cholestasis Type 2, underwent a successful liver transplant in October.

153.title: He's a petty troll: Cong leader on Assam CM calling Rahul 'Saddam Hussein'
153.article_body: Congress leader Manish Tewari, on Wednesday, said that Assam CM, who called Rahul Gandhi "Saddam Hussein", sounded like a "cheap troll". "In public life, it is very important that we maintain the decorum of language and propriety," Tewari said. Citing the Morbi bridge collapse as an example, Tewari said that BJP has become "arrogant".

154.title: Received 55,497 user data requests from India in 1st half of 2022: Meta
154.article_body: Meta said that it received 55,497 requests from India to provide user data in the first half of 2022, second to the US which asked for similar information. Meta also said that it restricted access in India to 597 items in response to directions from the IT Ministry. Notably, India made 50,382 such requests in the second half of 2021.

155.title: Being associated with Dharma made me easy target to hate: Janhvi
155.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor has agreed that being associated with Karan Johar and Dharma Productions has made her an "easy target to hate". The actress made her Bollywood debut with 'Dhadak', which was co-produced by Karan Johar. Talking about it, Janhvi said she doesn't regret being launched by the filmmaker but feels "unbelievably lucky and privileged".

156.title: Meaningless cricket played meaninglessly: Harmison on Eng's 0-3 series loss
156.article_body: Reacting to England's 0-3 whitewash in the recently concluded ODI series against Australia, ex-England pacer Steve Harmison said, "It was meaningless cricket played in a meaningless way." Sharing his opinion on the whitewash, ex-England wicketkeeper Matt Prior stated, "It was an absolute pumping. There was only one team that turned up all series. It was all a little bit inevitable."

157.title: Lightrock acquires majority stake in Sukoon Healthcare for $15 million
157.article_body: Lightrock India has made an investment of $15 million and acquired a significant stake in Sukoon Healthcare, a Gurugram-based psychiatric inpatient unit. Saleem Asaria, a partner at Lightrock India, will assume executive chairman's role, while founders Vidit Bahri and Kanishk Gupta will assume senior leadership roles. Sukoon plans to scale to multiple locations and expand specialist services.

158.title: World's most expensive drug approved to treat hemophilia at $3.5 million a dose
158.article_body: US regulators approved CSL Behring's hemophilia B gene therapy, a one-off infusion that costs $3.5 million a dose, making it the most expensive medicine in the world. Hemophilia B is a genetic bleeding disorder. Hemgenix works by delivering a gene that can produce the missing clotting factors into the liver, where it starts working to make the Factor IX protein.

159.title: SC to have special bench from next week to deal with tax cases: CJI
159.article_body: Chief Justice of India (CJI) DY Chandrachud on Tuesday said that the Supreme Court will have a special bench to exclusively deal with tax cases from next week onwards. "There will be a special bench from next week onwards, on Wednesdays and Fridays, to deal with direct and indirect sales tax matters solely," CJI Chandrachud told a group of lawyers.

160.title: Married man shoots girlfriend dead in OYO hotel in Delhi, tries to kill himself
160.article_body: A 38-year-old married man named Praveen allegedly shot his girlfriend Geeta in the chest and killed her following an argument in an OYO hotel in Delhi. He also tried to kill himself by shooting in the head, however, he survived and is hospitalised. According to reports, Praveen was arrested in another murder case earlier and is currently out on bail.

161.title: Mumbai man cuts b'day cake at crematorium, hosts biryani party to bust myth
161.article_body: A man from Mumbai's Kalyan reportedly celebrated his 44th birthday at a crematorium to bust myths associated with such places. Gautam More not only cut his birthday cake there but also hosted a biryani party for family and friends at Kalyan's Mohane crematorium. More is a member of Maharashtra Andhashraddha Nirmoolan Samiti. He runs campaigns to create awareness against superstitions.

162.title: Hyd Police invoke PD Act against woman involved in human trafficking
162.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police on Tuesday invoked Preventive Detention (PD) Act against a woman, Nusrath Begum, who was allegedly involved in human trafficking. In 2022, Nusrath was involved in two cases of human trafficking for the sake of prostitution, police stated. Nusrath was arrested in May for allegedly kidnapping and forcing a minor into prostitution and was also arrested in October.

163.title: 4 women kidnap man on pretext of asking address, rape him in car in Punjab
163.article_body: Four women aged between 22 and 23 kidnapped a man on the pretext of asking for an address and raped him by taking turns in a car in Punjab's Jalandhar, reports said. The victim said the women made him unconscious and abducted him when he was showing them the address. He was later left on the road by the women.

164.title: Karnataka man arrested for 'purifying' tank after Dalit woman drank water
164.article_body: A 62-year-old man was arrested in Karnataka's Chamarajanagar district for allegedly draining out water from a public tank and "purifying" it with cow urine after a Dalit woman drank water from it. The woman visited Heggotara for a wedding and drank water from the tank after having lunch. The villagers allegedly abused the woman and decided to purify the tank.

165.title: IIT-Bombay submits report to BMC on Gokhale bridge, suggests minor repairs
165.article_body: IIT-Bombay on Tuesday submitted its report to Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) on Gokhale Bridge in Andheri, which has been shut for both vehicular and pedestrian movement since November 7. According to a BMC official, experts from IIT said the bridge can be opened for two and three-wheelers in the middle portion if some minor corrections are made below the bridge.

166.title: Wouldn't have led SRH in 2014 had I known about the duration: Dhawan
166.article_body: Shikhar Dhawan said he "wouldn't have" led SRH in IPL 2014 if he had known about the fact that he'll be leading the franchise for only half a season. "I was not performing as a batter, so probably they...felt I was under pressure," added Dhawan. "I still feel that you should be given a full season of captaincy," he stated.

167.title: Prison admin's fault, reports to political system: Kiran Bedi on Jain's videos
167.article_body: After AAP leader Satyendar Jain’s videos from Tihar jail surfaced, former IPS officer Kiran Bedi said, "It is the prison administration’s fault, it reports to the political system." Furthermore, she said, "Maybe he didn't know there are cameras everywhere in Tihar jail. Everything is being recorded. It should be checked if he is also being given a salary," she added.

168.title: UP court declares Shahjahanpur BJP MP as absconder
168.article_body: Local BJP MP Arun Kumar Sagar was declared as an absconder by a special MP/MLA court in UP’s Shahjahanpur after he failed to appear before it in connection with a case pertaining to the seizure of poll material in 2019. In 2019, the then SDM Sadar seized campaign material of Sagar on the Bareilly-Jalalabad road and a case was registered.

169.title: VI shareholders approve issuing ₹1,600-cr debentures to ATC Telecom
169.article_body: Debt-ridden Vodafone Idea's (VI) shareholders have approved issuing debentures worth ₹1,600 crore to ATC Telecom Infrastructure on a preferential basis. The due amount will be converted into equities if the amount remained unpaid for 18 months. VI is raising the amount through equity convertible debt bonds that carry a coupon rate of 11.2% per annum payable every six months.

170.title: Actor Vikram Gokhale admitted to hospital, condition critical
170.article_body: Veteran actor Vikram Gokhale was admitted to Pune's Deenanath Mangeshkar Hospital a few days back. His condition remains critical, according to a tweet by ANI. Gokhale's family is yet to issue an official statement on his health. He has been a part of several Bollywood films including 'Hum Dil De Chuke Sanam' and 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa', among others.

171.title: Shot almost half of the film blindfolded: Taapsee on 'Blurr'
171.article_body: Taapsee Pannu said that she was blindfolded for almost half of her upcoming film 'Blurr', which is also co-produced by the actress. Talking about the film, Taapsee said the film's script was an "immediate yes" for her. 'Blurr' also stars Gulshan Devaiah and is directed by Ajay Bahl. The psychological thriller will release on OTT platform on December 9.

172.title: We got exactly what we wanted: Buttler after series whitewash vs Aus
172.article_body: England captain Jos Buttler said his team got "exactly" what they wanted from their recently concluded tour of Australia, having suffered a 0-3 whitewash in the ODI series. "It's just been a few games too far...Australia have outplayed us...It has...been hard. I am not fussed at all about the results, to be honest," added Buttler.

173.title: Savarkar chapter is closed: Congress' Jairam Ramesh
173.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Wednesday said that the "Savarkar chapter is closed". He was addressing a press conference in Madhya Pradesh.
