Earlier, Sanjay Raut, the spokesperson of Uddhav Thackeray’s faction of Shiv Sena, said that Congress leader Rahul Gandhi’s remarks on Veer Savarkar will not be accepted in Maharashtra and will cause cracks in the MVA alliance.

174.title: BJP's Adhikari skips WB Guv's oath due to seating plan, calls it humiliating
174.article_body: BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari refused to attend the oath-taking ceremony of incoming West Bengal Governor CV Ananda Bose on Wednesday. He said the placement of his seat behind TMC MPs during the oath-taking ceremony was done on purpose to "humiliate the Opposition". "This is a misuse of the opportunity given to her (CM Mamata Banerjee)," he said.

175.title: Foxconn confirms 'violence' at China iPhone factory as videos of clashes go viral
175.article_body: Foxconn has confirmed the overnight "violence" that took place at its iPhone factory in China. In a statement, Foxconn said the workers had complained about pay and conditions at the plant and said it will "prevent similar incidents from happening again". Several viral videos from the incident showed hundreds of workers clashing with security guards and personnel in hazmat suits.

176.title: What is the wait time for US visitor visa appointment in different Indian cities?
176.article_body: The US has listed that people applying for visitor visa in Delhi will have to wait 961 days for an appointment. The wait time for visitor visa in Mumbai is 999 days. The waiting period for visitor visa in Kolkata, Hyderabad and Chennai is 904, 994 and 948 days, respectively. The estimated wait time can change weekly, the website said.

177.title: Will end VIP darshan practice in temples: Tamil Nadu minister
177.article_body: Tamil Nadu minister PK Sekar Babu has said that the government will gradually end the practice of VIP darshan in temples in the state. He said the practice of giving VIP darshan tickets at the Anjaneyar temple in Namakkal has been stopped. "Though it generated ₹40 lakh revenue to the temple annually, we decided to scrap it," he said.

178.title: Sushant Singh Rajput's ex-manager Disha Salian's death was accidental: CBI
178.article_body: After probing Sushant Singh Rajput's former manager Disha Salian's death case, the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has concluded that she died by accident. "Salian, who had consumed alcohol, lost her balance and slipped from the parapet of her flat," a CBI official said. Disha (28) had fallen from her apartment's 14th floor in Mumbai on June 8, 2020.

179.title: Shraddha could have been saved if action was taken on her complaint in 2020: Fadnavis
179.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis said he has seen the police complaint filed by Shraddha Walkar against Aftab Poonawala in 2020, adding, "Maybe she could have been saved if action was taken." He said, "I don't want to accuse anyone but if action is not taken, such incidents happen." He added it will be investigated why action was not taken.

180.title: Satyendar Jain moves Delhi court to restrain media from airing CCTV clips
180.article_body: Jailed Delhi Minister Satyendar Jain moved an application in Delhi court seeking its direction to restrain media to air or broadcast any clip of CCTV footage related to him in Tihar jail. This comes after CCTV footage of Jain getting "proper food" and massage inside jail went viral. The matter will be taken up by the Delhi court on Thursday.

181.title: Asia's largest US consulate set to open in Hyd in January 2023
181.article_body: Asia's largest US consulate is set to open in Hyderabad's financial district in January 2023 for which the US has invested $297 million. The consulate is made on a 12.2-acre site and will have 55 visa procession windows. The US Consulate in Hyderabad first opened in 2009 and is located in Paigah Palace, Chiran Fort Lane, Begumpet.

182.title: 'Modi sarkar par bharosa mat karo, shaadi karlo', says Owaisi
182.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Tuesday used a joke to take a jibe at PM Narendra Modi over the high unemployment rate in India. "Modi sarkar par bharosa mat karo, tum shaadi karlo," Owaisi quoted a man as saying to the woman he loved, whose father was getting her married to another man because he didn't have a government job.

183.title: Simu Liu reacts to Quentin Tarantino's anti-Marvel remark
183.article_body: After Quentin Tarantino said that Marvel actors are "not movie stars", actor Simu Liu tweeted that he's proud to have worked with Marvel Studios that made efforts to improve diversity on screen. "If the only gatekeepers to movie stardom came from Tarantino and Scorsese, I would never have had the opportunity to lead a $400 million plus movie," he added.

184.title: Jet Airways loses accreditation for aviation security training
184.article_body: Aviation security agency Bureau of Civil Aviation Security (BCAS) withdrew its accreditation of Jet Airways' security training facilities. The Jalan Kalrock consortium, who won the bid to acquire the airline, said they surrendered the accreditation voluntarily. Amid uncertainty of Jet Airways' revival, the airline said it would reduce staff salaries and send many employees on leave without pay.

185.title: Mumbai local train services to remain hit till Nov 26 due to mega block
185.article_body: The Mumbai local train services will remain affected till November 26 as Western Railway is carrying out a mega block for repair and maintenance of Heritage building at Bandra on DNLL and C/LOOP line. The railway block has been undertaken from 1:35 am on the intervening night of November 22-23 to 4:35 am on November 26.

186.title: Ensure your name on voter list to avoid detention under NRC: Mamata
186.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has urged people to ensure that their name is on voter list to avoid being sent to detention camps "in...name of National Register of Citizens (NRC)". She also mentioned incidents of land being "forcibly taken over" by railway and airport authorities, adding, "No eviction will be allowed in Bengal without proper compensation and rehabilitation."

187.title: Adani group's cash generation ability underappreciated: M&G Investments
187.article_body: Billionaire Gautam Adani's group hasn't been appreciated enough for its cash-flow generation ability, said Vikas Pershad, fund manager at M&G Investments. He added that Adani is incubating and operating in real businesses that generate cash such as ports, airports, rail and logistics. "[The] businesses will grow if India grows. They're at the right place at the right time," he said.

188.title: Marvel actors are not movie stars: Quentin Tarantino
188.article_body: Filmmaker Quentin Tarantino said that characters of Marvel films might be popular but the actors cannot be called movie stars. He said that while he isn't against Marvel and DC movies, he has "problem" with the fact that they "are the entire representation of this era of movies" and the "only things" that seem to generate excitement among the audience.

189.title: No chance of me withdrawing from IPL, want to get every cent: Maxwell
189.article_body: Australia all-rounder Glenn Maxwell said there is no chance of him withdrawing from the IPL. "I want to cash in on every cent possible and then retire happily," added Maxwell. "I'll...work on avoiding tissue injuries that could happen as an older player," he stated. Pat Cummins is among the players who will not participate in the next edition of IPL.

190.title: EU confirms investigating TikTok over its data practices
190.article_body: The EU has confirmed that there are multiple ongoing investigations into TikTok over its data practices and targeted advertising aimed at minors. They include an investigation by Ireland about TikTok's compliance with several General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) requirements. TikTok also faces a litigation before the Dutch courts concerning targeted advertising and data transfers to China.

191.title: Manholes are death traps, close them up in a week: Bombay HC to BMC
191.article_body: The Bombay High Court on Tuesday called open manholes 'death traps' and said people may unknowingly fall in them and hurt themselves grievously. Chief Justice Dipankar Datta and Justice Abhay Ahuja, while hearing a contempt petition filed by lawyer Ruju Thakker, gave the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) a week to close the manholes on the Eastern Express Highway.

192.title: Haryana to cancel criminal cases against farmers during farm laws agitation
192.article_body: The Haryana government has decided to withdraw criminal cases registered against farmers, barring heinous crimes, during their 2020-21 agitation against the now-scrapped farm laws. Also, no action will be taken against government employees who supported the agitation. Following this, the Bhartiya Kisan Union (BKU), Charuni, has called off Delhi-Chandigarh highway blockade scheduled on Thursday.

193.title: Latest rankings for T20I batters released; Kohli, Rohit, Rahul slip
193.article_body: The ICC today released the latest rankings for T20I batters, with Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma and KL Rahul dropping spots. Virat Kohli is now ranked 13th, while KL Rahul and Rohit Sharma are ranked 19th and 21st, respectively. Suryakumar Yadav continues to be on top of the rankings and has a 54-rating point lead over second-placed Muhammad Rizwan.

194.title: Train operator prevents woman's suicide bid on Navi Mumbai railway track
194.article_body: A 54-year-old on-duty operator of a suburban train saved an 18-year-old woman who was lying on a railway track in Navi Mumbai on Tuesday. Prashant Konnur prevented the train from hitting the woman by applying emergency brakes on time. The woman had allegedly attempted suicide. Konnur counselled her and helped her board the women's compartment of the train.

195.title: Hyderabad teacher sentenced to 10 yrs in jail for molesting minor boy
195.article_body: A 49-year-old private teacher in Hyderabad, Ravindran Prakash, was sentenced to 10 years in prison for molesting a minor boy. In 2018, Saroornagar Police received a complaint from the boy's father alleging that the accused sexually assaulted him while he was on his way to attend tuition. The POCSO Court imposed a fine of ₹45,000 on Prakash, a repeat offender.

196.title: Pune man kidnapped, beaten to death over cricket betting; 2 bookies arrested
196.article_body: A 32-year-old man from Pune was allegedly kidnapped and beaten to death over cricket betting last week. Police have arrested two bookies in connection with the case. According to police, the deceased owed money to the bookies, who were threatening him and demanding money before his abduction. The man ran a construction business in the past but was currently unemployed.

197.title: Russia has nearly exhausted current stock of Iran-made weapons: UK
197.article_body: Britain's Defence Ministry has said that it is likely that Russia has nearly exhausted its current stock of Iran-made weapons and will seek to restock. Russia has likely launched a number of Iranian manufactured un-crewed aerial vehicles against Ukraine since September, the statement added. Iran and Russia have reportedly reached a deal to start production of attack drones in Russia.

198.title: New Zealand hikes interest rate to 4.25%, the highest since 2009
198.article_body: The Reserve Bank of New Zealand increased interest rate by a record 75 basis points to 4.25%,  the highest since early 2009. The central bank warned of an entire year in recession to rein in inflation. This is the first time the bank has raised rate by more than a half-point since the Official Cash Rate was introduced in 1999.

199.title: ICC releases all-time T20I batting rankings, Suryakumar just 2 points behind Kohli
199.article_body: The ICC today released the latest all-time T20I batting rankings, with India's Suryakumar Yadav breaking into the top five. Suryakumar achieved his career-best 895 rating points on November 20 and is now placed fifth on the all-time rankings. He is just two rating points behind third-ranked Virat Kohli, who had achieved his career-best 897 rating points on September 7, 2014.

200.title: False: Musk on reports of FTX Founder owning a $100 million stake in Twitter
200.article_body: Twitter's new owner Elon Musk has denied reports of bankrupt crypto exchange FTX's Founder and former CEO Sam Bankman-Fried owning a $100 million stake in Twitter. Responding to a tweet by a news website regarding the same, Musk responded, "False". Earlier, several message exchanges between Musk and Sam regarding the Twitter takeover had surfaced online.

201.title: Manoj Tiwari to become a father again at 51; shares celebration video
201.article_body: Actor-politician Manoj Tiwari is set to become a father for the third time at 51. He took to social media to share a video from his wife's baby shower and wrote, "Some happiness cannot be described in words...it can just be felt." The couple already have a daughter together and Manoj Tiwari also has a daughter from his ex-wife.

202.title: India & BJP have become synonymous: Gajendra Shekhawat in Gujarat
202.article_body: Campaigning for Gujarat elections, Union Jal Shakti Minister Gajendra Shekhawat on Tuesday said that India and BJP have become synonymous. Claiming that the Congress party divided Gujarat on caste basis, Shekhawat at a rally in Gandhinagar said, "There was a time when our Gujarat, especially Ahmedabad and Gandhinagar were known as cities of riots."

203.title: Colorado gay nightclub shooting suspect who killed 5 is non-binary: Court filing
203.article_body: The alleged shooter who killed five people at a gay nightclub in US state of Colorado is non-binary and uses they/them pronouns, his legal team said. It has also been revealed that the 22-year-old shooter, Anderson Lee Aldrich, was known as Nicholas Franklin Brink until 2016. The suspect's father is a pornography performer with an extensive criminal history, records show.

204.title: Leopard spotted on IIT-Bombay campus; forest officials alerted
204.article_body: A distress call was made to the forest department on Monday morning after a leopard was allegedly spotted on the campus of IIT-Bombay. A forest official said, "Our teams are initiating all necessary actions." Leopards, which are generally nocturnal, can be spotted in the area in day too as the campus lies near the Sanjay Gandhi National Park, he added.

205.title: Wait time for US visitor visa reaches nearly 1,000 days in Delhi
205.article_body: The appointment waiting time for applicants of B-1 and B-2 visitor visas for the US has reached 961 days in Delhi, according to US State Department website. "The estimated wait time to receive...interview appointment...can change weekly and is based on actual incoming workload and staffing," it said. "These are estimates only and do not guarantee...availability of...appointment," the website read.

206.title: He can go to any level: Cong leader on Assam CM's 'Saddam Hussein' remark
206.article_body: Following Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma’s "Saddam Hussein" remark for Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, Congress’ Bhupen Kumar Borah said Sarma can go to any level for power. "You just want a headline and you get that only when you take Rahul Gandhi’s name. Himanta Biswa Sarma can say anything," he added. "We don’t pay attention," Borah stated.

207.title: India repatriates Pakistani national after he serves 10 years in jail
207.article_body: A Pakistani national, who had entered India illegally, was repatriated through the Attari-Wagah border on Tuesday after he served his 10-year-long jail term, an official confirmed. Kala Massi had allegedly entered India without a passport and visa in 2011 and was apprehended in Punjab's Majitha, where a pistol and cartridge were recovered from him. Massi hails from Pakistan's Narowal.

208.title: Ready to re-launch Jet Airways within 60-90 days of ownership transfer: CEO
208.article_body: Jet Airways CEO Sanjiv Kapoor on Wednesday said that they are ready to re-launch within 60-90 days of the transfer of ownership. "There is no standoff between the lenders and the consortium. Both parties are working together for the implementation of the approved resolution plan," Kapoor added. Last week, Jet Airways reduced the salaries of nearly 33% of the employees.

209.title: Give us our pay: Shout workers as men smash cameras at China iPhone plant
209.article_body: People smashed surveillance cameras and windows at the world's largest iPhone factory run by Foxconn in China's Zhengzhou as the workers shouted, "Give us our pay!" Videos of the incident showed workers protesting and they were surrounded by people in full hazmat suits, some carrying batons. The protest reportedly started over unpaid wages and fear of spreading infection.

210.title: Didn't know what sexual harassment was before Bombshell: Margot Robbie
210.article_body: Actress Margot Robbie has said that she did not know the definition of sexual harassment before she worked in the 2019 film 'Bombshell'. "I always thought [sexual harassment] required physical contact for it to be considered illegal or wrong," Margot added. She stated that she was shocked to know that "any unwelcome sexual advances" was included in sexual harassment.

211.title: Rumours about new traffic fines in Hyderabad fake: Police
211.article_body: The Hyderabad Police have asked citizens not to believe in any rumours about "new traffic fines" in the city warning that those who are found spreading the fake information will be prosecuted as per law. The police further said that the fines against traffic violations are in accordance with 2011 guidelines issued in the erstwhile combined state of Andhra Pradesh.

212.title: B'luru man kills friend over money, goes to police with body in car
212.article_body: A 32-year-old man was arrested for killing his friend in Bengaluru and taking his body to a police station in a car. According to the police, the deceased had taken over ₹2 crore from the accused's mother and some of her friends after promising to get her a loan at subsidised interest but refused to return the money.

213.title: Ex-US President Trump loses legal bid to prevent release of tax returns
213.article_body: The US Supreme Court has rejected former US President Donald Trump's emergency application which sought to prevent the Treasury Department from releasing his six years of tax returns to a congressional committee. The Democrat-controlled Ways and Means Committee, has been seeking Trump's tax returns since 2019. Trump's lawyers argued that the committee lacks legal basis for requesting tax returns.

214.title: 2 traffic violators beat up woman police & her colleagues in Pune; arrested
214.article_body: Pimpri-Chinchwad Police have arrested two persons for allegedly beating up an on-duty woman traffic police and her colleagues at Dehu Phata chowk. The accused, Bhushan Jain and Dattatraya Kokare, allegedly manhandled and sexually molested the female police when she asked them to not use a closed road. When her colleagues tried to intervene, they also allegedly threw punches at them.

215.title: PMC to undertake beautification work ahead of G20 summit meetings in city
215.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has commenced preparations ahead of next year's G20 summit by undertaking road repair work in parts of the city where delegates may visit. "The civic administration has received 43 proposals for beautification of junctions and so far approved work for...12 junctions," an official said. Notably, a few summit meetings will also be held in Mumbai.

216.title: Car catches fire in Thane, no casualties reported
216.article_body: A Honda Mobility car at Hiranandani Meadows in Thane reportedly caught fire on Tuesday night. While the car was damaged, no casualties were reported in the incident. Thane's Regional Disaster Management Cell (RDMC) chief Avinash Sawant said their team, along with fire brigade personnel and one fire vehicle, reached the spot and doused the fire within an hour.

217.title: Fake educational certificate racket busted in Hyderabad, 3 arrested
217.article_body: The Hyderabad Police arrested three people for selling fake educational certificates from various universities and supporting and VISA documents to needy students at the price of ₹50,000-₹60,000. According to police, the main accused used to run a flex designing unit. Among the other two accused, one used to work in an educational consultancy and other as a visa processing counsellor.

218.title: Shraddha's murder was well-planned & not heat of moment act, says expert
218.article_body: Apollo hospital's Senior Consultant Psychiatrist, Dr Sandeep Vohra, on Tuesday said that Shraddha's murder was a well-planned move and not an act that could've happened in the heat of the moment. He said that the way Aftab acted after killing Shraddha can only be done by someone who has psychopathic traits, adding that the accused has no remorse.

219.title: Meghalaya villagers burn down forest office in Assam district
219.article_body: A group of villagers from Meghalaya burned down a forest office in Assam's West Karbi Anglong district, said officials. The incident occurred soon after six people died in firing during a clash between Assam Police and Meghalaya villagers at the interstate border. Villagers, carrying machetes, rods and sticks, torched furniture, documents and motorcycles parked in the complex, officials added.

220.title: Satyendar Jain enjoying resort-like facilities in Tihar jail: Lekhi
220.article_body: AAP leader Satyendar Jain is enjoying facilities similar to a holiday resort inside Tihar jail, Union Minister Meenakashi Lekhi said. Her statement came after a new CCTV footage from Tihar jail showed Jain getting "proper food" in jail. "There's food being served on a platter, masseur facility is available, it isn't a luxury resort," Lekhi stated.

221.title: UP CM Yogi launches 755 projects worth ₹878 crore in Ghaziabad
221.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath inaugurated and laid the foundation stone for 755 projects worth a total of about ₹878 crore in Ghaziabad on Tuesday. During the event, Adityanath said that before 2017, the city was among the "dirtiest and no investments came here", however, now it has an expressway and "the country's first rapid train will also commence here".

222.title: SpaceX launches Eutelsat 10B mission from Florida's Cape Canaveral
222.article_body: SpaceX on Tuesday launched Eutelsat 10B communications satellite from Cape Canaveral Space Force Station in Florida. The satellite, launched using a Falcon 9 rocket, will provide internet service to air and sea traffic. The Elon Musk-led space company on Monday said weather was 20% favourable and delayed the launch to allow for additional pre-flight checkouts.

223.title: Musk finds closet full of '#StayWoke' t-shirts at Twitter headquarters
223.article_body: Elon Musk found a closet full of t-shirts with '#StayWoke' written on them at Twitter's headquarters in San Francisco and shared a video of the closet on Twitter. Twitter's former CEO Jack Dorsey popularised the t-shirts following the killing of 18-year-old Michael Brown in the US. It was a call for awareness against the alleged police violence against Black people.

224.title: Karnataka court stays distribution, sale of book on Tipu Sultan
224.article_body: A court in Karnataka stayed the distribution and sale of a book on Tipu Sultan, titled 'Tipu Nija Kanasugalu' (Real Dreams of Tipu). This comes after former Chairman of the District Wakf Board Committee, BS Rafiulla, filed a suit contending the book contains incorrect information on Tipu Sultan and that it could cause unrest and communal disharmony.

225.title: Man beaten to death over non-payment of debt in Pune; 2 arrested
225.article_body: Two repeat offenders were arrested after a 32-year-old man was beaten to death over non-payment of debt in Pune, officials said on Tuesday. The deceased had borrowed ₹28,000 from one of the accused, according to officials. The deceased's wife claimed that the accused had called her husband for a meeting in Bibwewadi earlier this month, then kidnapped and killed him.

226.title: Delhivery stock falls by 5.3% to 52-week low after large trade report
226.article_body: Shares of logistics company Delhivery fell by 5.3% to a 52-week low of ₹317/piece after reports of a large trade. Delhivery shares were trading with cuts in the sixth straight trading session. Bloomberg data showed at least 12.8 lakh shares changed hands in large trade. At 1:47 pm, the company's stock was trading 4.42% lower at ₹320.10/share on the NSE.

227.title: 1 dead in twin blasts in Jerusalem, police says 'Haven't seen such attack in years'
227.article_body: Two explosions at bus stops on Jerusalem's outskirts killed one and wounded up to 15 people on Wednesday, emergency services said. The Israeli police said it appeared to be an attack by Palestinian militants. Israel's police chief Kobi Shabtai said, "We haven't seen such an attack in years," adding that police are searching for more possible explosives in the city.

228.title: Mumbai local train services disrupted after commuter gets hit by train
228.article_body: Mumbai's suburban local train services were acutely disrupted on Wednesday morning due to a case of trespassing between Borivali and Kandivali. Nearly three-four trains were affected after a person was hit by train, according to the Western Railway officials. The person who was hit has been taken to a nearby hospital, the officials added.

229.title: German Catholic Church amends law to allow LGBTQ employees to work
229.article_body: The Catholic Church in Germany has amended its law stating that all employees can be representatives of a church that serves people, independent of their sexual identity. The amendment comes after 125 employees of the Catholic Church came out as queer in a demonstration. Earlier, Catholic Church employees could lose their jobs for being open about having a same-sex partner.

230.title: It's hard to watch him bat, embarrassing: Maxwell on Suryakumar's 111*
230.article_body: Australia all-rounder Glenn Maxwell said Suryakumar Yadav is batting on a "completely different" planet, adding that his 111* in the second T20I against New Zealand was "hard to watch". "It's embarrassing that he's so much better than everyone else," stated Maxwell. Talking about Suryakumar potentially playing in the Big Bash League, Maxwell said, "We won't be able to afford him."

231.title: How long will CM Sangma let Assam CM take Meghalaya for granted?: TMC MP
231.article_body: TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee on Tuesday said that he was "deeply saddened" by the firing incident at the Assam-Meghalaya border that left six persons, including an Assam forest official, dead. Adding that the incident showed the Meghalaya government's "ineptitude", he further said, "For how long will CM Conrad Sangma allow [Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma] to take Meghalaya for granted?"

232.title: Accepted small roles for survival, had no alternative: Nawazuddin
232.article_body: While revisiting his journey in Bollywood, actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui revealed that he accepted small roles to survive in the film industry. "I had no other alternative," he said, adding that it is the "difficult time that makes you strong". He shared that before becoming an actor, he worked as a chemist in a petrochemical company for a short while.

233.title: The fire has spread in the jungle: Kaif on Shreyas' golden duck vs NZ
233.article_body: Discussing Shreyas Iyer's dismissal for a golden duck in India's third T20I against New Zealand, Mohammad Kaif said, "The fire has spread in the jungle, everyone knows how Shreyas plays against the short ball." "Hard length, short ball, a slip was placed. Every bowler bowls...[bouncers to] Shreyas," added Kaif. Shreyas scored 13 runs in the T20I series against New Zealand.

234.title: 2 men molest female constable in Pune after being stopped at no-vehicle zone
234.article_body: A female traffic constable was allegedly molested and pushed to ground in Pune while her male colleague was attacked by two men whom she stopped after they tried to force their way into a no-vehicle zone created for a pilgrimage in Alandi, police said. They were arrested. One of them allegedly grabbed her by the chest and pushed her hard.

235.title: Who was ex-poll body chief TN Seshan for whom SC said 'Seshan happens once in a while'?
235.article_body: Supreme Court on Tuesday praised former Chief Election Commissioner TN Seshan, saying, "Seshan happens once in a while". Seshan is credited for major electoral reforms as he introduced a list of 150 malpractices during elections, including liquor distribution, bribing, use of religion in speeches. He introduced voter ID cards, Model Code of Conduct, and enforced a limit to poll expenses.

236.title: Actress Aindrila Sharma's boyfriend kisses her feet at her funeral
236.article_body: The boyfriend of actress Aindrila Sharma, who passed away on Sunday in Kolkata, was seen kneeling before her body and kissing her feet at her funeral. Videos on social media also showed Sabyasachi Chowdhury performing the last rites with Aindrila's father. Sabyasachi appears to have deleted his social media accounts following Aindrila's demise.

237.title: Musk blocked Twitter staff's corporate cards, refused to reimburse travel bills: Report
237.article_body: After taking over Twitter, Elon Musk blocked employees' corporate credit cards, a report by The New York Times said. Musk reportedly refused to reimburse travel invoices of current and former employees, while his staff said that the services were authorised by the company’s former management and not him. His staff is said to have been avoiding calls from travel vendors.

238.title: Meesho joins ONDC to support inclusive e-commerce ecosystem
238.article_body: Bengaluru-based online retailer Meesho announced its integration with the government's Open Network for Digital Commerce (ONDC). The pilot will be launched in Bengaluru and gradually rolled out in other locations over the coming months, it said. The move will help connect buyers with hyperlocal sellers and support India's vision of creating an inclusive e-commerce ecosystem, the startup said.

239.title: Hyderabad police constable saves electrocuted man by giving CPR
239.article_body: A police constable of Banjara Hill Traffic Police Station in Hyderabad performed Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR) to save a man who suffered an electric shock on Tuesday evening. This incident took place near GVK House’s main gate. After administering CPR, the police constable, A Shankar, called an ambulance and took the man to a nearby hospital.

240.title: I was obsessed with my body & weight at 17: Alia Bhatt
240.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt said that at the age of 17, she was obsessed with her body and her weight. She admitted that the obsession “took a toll” on her. The actress further shared that during her pregnancy, she felt “comfortable”, “happy and more at peace” with her body. Alia recently welcomed her first child, a baby girl.

241.title: 35 illegal structures on Pune's Navale bridge service roads razed
241.article_body: At least 35 illegal constructions have been demolished by the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) on service roads along the Navale bridge on the Mumbai-Bengaluru highway in Pune, the police said. The step was taken after a truck had hit several vehicles on Sunday and caused a pile-up on the highway leaving several people injured.

242.title: Son hospitalised after CRPF beat him, not allowed to see him: Malla Reddy on I-T raids
242.article_body: Telangana Labour Minister Chamakura Malla Reddy has claimed that his elder son has been hospitalised after being beaten "entire night" by CRPF personnel, who accompanied Income Tax Department officials during raids at several places linked to him. "They are not allowing my son's doctor to visit him. They are not even allowing me to see him," he added.

243.title: Stop all construction work on Sukhatal near Naini Lake: HC to govt
243.article_body: The Uttarakhand High Court on Tuesday ordered the government to stop all construction activities on the bed of Sukhatal, which is less than a kilometre from Naini Lake in Nainital. This comes after a group of 104 local activists and citizens wrote to the HC Chief Justice, who took suo moto cognizance of the matter.

244.title: Working closely with law enforcement: Walmart after fatal shooting in US store
244.article_body: Several people died and many others were injured after a shooting took place at a Walmart store in Virginia on Tuesday night. Sharing a statement about the same, Walmart tweeted, "We are shocked at this tragic event at our Chesapeake, Virginia store. We're praying for those impacted...We’re working closely with law enforcement, and we are focused on supporting our associates."

245.title: Felt I could play in T20 WC 2022, not being there really hurt: Venkatesh
245.article_body: All-rounder Venkatesh Iyer said he felt "really hurt" as he wasn't able to represent India in the T20 World Cup 2022. "I don't want to put myself in a position to think about something which is really far away from me," added Venkatesh. "I would have wanted to be there, but again it is not in my hands," he stated.

246.title: Rahul Gandhi's Bharat Jodo Yatra enters Madhya Pradesh
246.article_body: After a two-day break, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi-led Bharat Jodo Yatra resumed as it entered Madhya Pradesh on Wednesday. The foot march resumed from Boderli village in the Burhanpur district. Former MP CMs Kamal Nath and Digvijaya Singh joined Gandhi in the march. The party is aiming to pass through seven districts of the state over the next 11 days.

247.title: Ukraine promises shelter, electricity, internet to people as winter nears
247.article_body: Ukrainian government has promised to provide shelters with heat and water to people and encouraged them to save energy as winter approaches. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that special "invincibility centres" will be set up around the country to provide electricity, internet, mobile phone connections and a pharmacy free of cost and around the clock.

248.title: Ex-Niti Aayog VC Rajiv Kumar joins India Sotheby's advisory board
248.article_body: Former Vice Chairman of the Niti Aayog Rajiv Kumar has joined India Sotheby's International Realty's policy and advisory board. Kumar will advise the company on policy and advocacy matters with the objective of promoting transparency and professionalism in the real estate sector, India Sotheby's International Realty said. Kumar is an alumnus of St Stephen's College and Lucknow University.

249.title: 2 assault revenue officers, tear land records in GB Nagar village
249.article_body: A case has been filed after two suspects threatened, abused and assaulted revenue officers in a village in Gautam Buddha Nagar's Dadri, police said. The accused also tore land records when the revenue officers reached the village to measure land parcels. Police personnel were accompanying the revenue officers, however, they left midway due to some confusion over jurisdiction, officials said.

250.title: We will pick bowlers who can intimidate the batter: Hardik Pandya
250.article_body: Sharing his approach to captaincy, Hardik Pandya said, "For me and my bowling unit, the plan is simple - Let's be aggressive. What's...[the worst thing that can] happen? We will...lose the game or maybe they'll score 200." "Aggressive is not about going for [a] wicket off every ball. It's about your behaviour...We'll pick bowlers...who can intimidate the batter," added Hardik.

251.title: Drug addict kills parents, sister, grandmother after returning home from rehab in Delhi
251.article_body:
A drug addict killed his entire family days after returning home from a rehabilitation centre in Delhi. He stabbed his parents, sister, and grandmother to death after a fight, the police said on 
Wednesday. The neighbours who heard screams from the house caught the man as he tried to escape after murdering his family.

252.title: Jet Airways' stock falls by 15% in three days, hits new 52-week low
252.article_body: Jet Airways' stock fell by 15% in three consecutive sessions and hit a new 52-week low of ₹65.55/piece on Wednesday. Its stock dropped by 30% in November and is down by 26% in 2022 so far. With the Bureau of Civil Aviation Security withdrawing the accreditation given to its aviation security training facilities, the airline's revival plan has hit limbo.

253.title: Couple shares selfie after surviving plane crash in Peru, post goes viral
253.article_body: A selfie, clicked by a couple, who survived a plane crash at an airport in Peru has gone viral. Enrique Varsi-Rospigliosi shared the image on Twitter along with the caption, "When life gives you a second chance #latam." Two firefighters were killed when a LATAM airline passenger plane hit a firetruck during takeoff and caught fire on the runway.

254.title: TikTok may have misled Congress on data sharing with China: US lawmakers
254.article_body: Republican lawmakers have raised concerns that China-owned TikTok may have misled the US Congress on how much user data it shares with China. "Some of the information TikTok provided...appears to be untrue or misleading, including that TikTok does not track US user locations," Republican lawmakers said in a letter to TikTok CEO Shou Zi Chew.

255.title: Man accused of handing out fake ID cards in B'luru data theft case arrested
255.article_body: The Bengaluru Police made its sixth arrest in the voter data theft case. Lokesh KM, the man who handed out fake ID cards that were used to conduct illegal voter surveys by NGO Chilume Educational Cultural and Rural Development Trust, was arrested on  Tuesday. Lokesh was absconding after cases were registered against him and was caught from outskirts of Bengaluru.

256.title: Balenciaga issues apology after ad features kids with bondage gear
256.article_body: Balenciaga issued an apology after receiving criticism over its recent ad campaign that featured children holding teddy bears dressed in bondage gear and used a photo of a Supreme Court opinion in a child pornography case as a prop. The company said, "We sincerely apologise for any offence our holiday campaign may have caused...We've removed the campaign from all platforms."

257.title: Videos show workers at Apple's biggest factory in China clash with security personnel
257.article_body: Hundreds of workers at the world's largest iPhone factory run by Foxconn in China clashed with security personnel amid strict COVID-19 restrictions on Wednesday. Several videos of the incident showed workers marching on the road with some being confronted by a row of people in hazmat suits. The violent protest reportedly started over unpaid wages and fear of spreading infection.

258.title: He'll kill me, cut me up in pieces: Shraddha in police complaint against Aftab in 2020
258.article_body: Shraddha Walkar, who was allegedly killed by Aftab Poonawala in Delhi, had filed a police complaint against him in Vasai in 2020, alleging that he tried to kill her. She wrote, "He blackmails that he will kill me, cut me up in pieces and throw me away." She added that his parents were aware that he tried to kill her.

259.title: Journalist heckled after regional Brazilian flag mistaken as LGBTQ symbol in Qatar
259.article_body: A Brazilian journalist covering FIFA World Cup in Qatar said that local police harassed him after regional Brazilian flag was mistaken for an LGBTQ pride flag. Victor Pereira said that authorities seized his phone after he recorded a man's negative reaction to a colourful flag that represented Brazil's Pernambuco state. Pernambuco Governor Paulo Camara expressed his solidarity with Pereira.

260.title: Faridabad to have ₹200 crore waste to methanol plant by Dec 2023
260.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Gurugram (MCG) has identified eight acres of land in Faridabad's Sihi to set up a ₹200 crore waste-to-methanol plant by December 2023, officials said. The plant will be used to convert 500 tonnes of waste into 50 kilo-litres of methanol daily. Methanol is commonly used as a fuel, antifreeze and as solvent.

261.title: Dr CV Ananda Bose takes oath as Governor of West Bengal
261.article_body: Retired IAS officer Dr CV Ananda Bose took oath as the Governor of West Bengal in Kolkata today. Bose will be replacing La Ganesan, who was appointed as the state Governor after Jagdeep Dhankhar was elected as the Vice-President of India. Earlier, Bose said that he sees Mamata Banerjee as a "respected" CM and he'll work with her with "objectivity".

262.title: Navi Mumbai man loses ₹1.59 crore in crypto investment
262.article_body: A 38-year-old man from Navi Mumbai lost ₹1.59 crore he invested in cryptocurrency on the advice of a woman he met on dating app OkCupid. The woman, who identified herself as a resident of the Philippines, told him that her family members are financial advisors. Initially, the man's $199 investment grew to $224, which convinced him to invest more.

263.title: She'll come out stronger: Shriya on Samantha's battle with myositis
263.article_body: Actress Shriya Saran wished speedy recovery for Samantha Ruth Prabhu, who recently opened up about being diagnosed with myositis. "This is a passing phase. She will come out strong," Shriya said, adding that Samantha is a "strong girl" and a "beautiful girl inside out". Shriya's latest release 'Drishyam 2', also starring Ajay Devgn, is doing well at the box office.

264.title: Temasek-backed Licious' losses surge by 130% in FY22, revenue up 64%
264.article_body: Bengaluru-based meat delivery startup Licious' losses surged by nearly 130% to ₹855 crore in FY22 year-on-year. The Temasek-backed startup's losses were driven by higher advertisement and promotional expenses, along with increasing employee benefit costs. The unicorn's revenue grew by 64% to ₹683 crore as against ₹416 crore in FY21. Its total expenses rose by 80% to ₹1,191 crore year-on-year.

265.title: Messi has to earn the right to win WC: Keane after Argentina's loss
265.article_body: Ex-Manchester United captain Roy Keane said Argentina captain Lionel Messi has to "earn the right" to win the FIFA World Cup following Argentina's 1-2 loss against Saudi Arabia in their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener. "You can't just say that a player deserves it...Messi and his teammates [need] to give themselves a chance of winning the World Cup," added Keane.

266.title: Andhra govt sets up exclusive cell to make it 'climate resilient'
266.article_body: The Andhra Pradesh government has set up an exclusive Climate Change Cell (CCC) for the implementation of its action plan and to make it "climate resilient through improved climate change governance". The cell's main aim is climate change mitigation and protection of vulnerable sections through an inclusive and sustainable development strategy, according to a state special chief secretary.

267.title: Brazil's Bolsonaro challenges result of presidential election he lost to Lula
267.article_body: Outgoing Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro has challenged the result of the presidential election he lost last month and demanded the election authority to annul votes cast on most of the nation's electronic voting machines. Bolsonaro, who lost the election to leftist leader Lula da Silva, blamed a software bug that caused "irreparable non-compliance due to malfunction".

268.title: Multiple people killed in shooting at Walmart store in US
268.article_body: Multiple people are dead and others are wounded after a shooting at a Walmart store in US' Virginia, police said. Police believe there was one shooter, who is dead, a spokesman said. The spokesman further said that he did not have a number of dead, adding that it was "less than 10, right now".

269.title: Centre generating about 16 lakh jobs every month: Ashwini Vaishnaw
269.article_body: Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Tuesday said about 16 lakh jobs are being generated every month by the Centre. He was addressing a ‘Rozgar Mela’ programme organised in Ajmer by the CRPF. "India has emerged as a source of energy with full of opportunities even in the situation of global economic crisis," he stated.

270.title: Why Rahul Gandhi now looks like Saddam Hussein?: Assam CM Himanta
270.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said Congress leader Rahul Gandhi’s looks have changed and he looks more like Saddam Hussein. "I said in a television interview...there's no problem with Rahul Gandhi's new look...at least make it like Vallabhbhai Patel," he added. "Even better if you look like Gandhiji but why do you look more like Saddam Hussein now?" Sarma asked.

271.title: Chai Point eyes IPO launch in the next 18-24 months: Report
271.article_body: Tea cafe chain Chai Point is looking to launch its IPO in the next 18-24 months, Moneycontrol reported. "Over the last one-and-a-half years, we have invested a lot in technology, building the brewing machines as we are driving for profitability...The goal is to list the company in about 18-24 months," Amuleek Singh Bijral, Co-founder and CEO of Chai Point said.

272.title: AFA should say it to my face if they don't want me to meet players: Aguero
272.article_body: Talking about the Argentina Football Association (AFA), former Argentina forward Sergio Aguero said, "I haven't seen the national team yet...Everything is kind of weird." "If the AFA doesn't want me to go, it's all good, but...[they should say it] to my face," added Aguero. "Maybe there are people who don't like being told bad things," he stated.

273.title: Congress demands case against BJYM for attack on its Pune office
273.article_body: The Congress party has demanded the police to file a case against BJP's youth wing Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha (BJYM) for the attack on its office in Pune last week. "When all party office-bearers were out of station to participate in the Bharat Jodo Yatra, the BJP youth workers tried to attack the Congress Bhavan," said Congress leader Arvind Shinde.

274.title: Dilip Kumar's sister Farida hospitalised in Mumbai: Report
274.article_body: Late actor Dilip Kumar's younger sister Farida is admitted at Kokilaben Dhirubhai Ambani Hospital in Mumbai since the last week, according to ETimes. Farida's nephews Saqib and Imran and Saira Banu are looking after her in the hospital, according to the report. Notably, Dilip Kumar passed away at the age of 98 in Mumbai last year.

275.title: Substantial amount of firm's assets stolen or missing: FTX lawyer
275.article_body: In FTX's bankruptcy hearing on Tuesday, FTX counsel James Bromley told a US court that "substantial amount of" the company's assets "have either been stolen or missing". Bromley added that the crypto exchange was "run as a personal fiefdom" of its ex-CEO Sam Bankman-Fried. "It's one of the most abrupt and difficult company collapses in...history of corporate America," he stated.

276.title: 'Wasn’t Twitter supposed to die by now?' Musk amid criticism after his takeover
276.article_body: Amid criticism over his takeover of Twitter, Elon Musk on Wednesday tweeted, "Wasn’t Twitter supposed to die by now or something…?" Musk further remarked, "Maybe we’ve gone to heaven/hell and don’t know it." After Musk’s takeover, his changes including layoffs at the company and an $8 blue tick subscription, among others, have been receiving criticism.

277.title: Which words have been selected for Oxford 'Word of the Year 2022'?
277.article_body: Three words - 'goblin mode', '#IStandWith' and 'metaverse' have been selected by Oxford University Press for its 'Word of the Year 2022'. It has been announced that the Oxford word of the year is to be decided by the public for the first time. They were chosen by a team of lexicographers from Oxford University Press.

278.title: Punjab school bans grandparents' entry at function; served notice
278.article_body: Punjab School Education Department has served a show-cause notice to a school in Khanna after it banned the entry of grandparents at the school's annual day function, state minister Harjot Singh Bains said. "The school showed disrespect towards our elders, which won't be tolerated," he added. Green Grove Public School was told to reply to the notice within two days.

279.title: 3 domestic helps arrested in Hyd, 81 tolas of gold jewellery recovered
279.article_body: The Narayanaguda Police arrested three domestic workers and recovered 81 tolas of gold ornaments worth ₹36 lakh from them. The accused were working in the house of an event organiser for the last 10 years. While the complainant was shifting his residence, he discovered that a box containing gold ornaments was missing. The police caught the accused within 24 hours.

280.title: Allen Solly announces The Tuxedo Wedding Collection
280.article_body: Allen Solly has launched the Tuxedo Wedding fest with exclusive offers & services across 50+ varieties of party suits and blazers, across major cities. Wedding shopping becomes special when you pick a masterpiece that suits your vibe, it said. The premium fabric, eye-catching hues, rich craftsmanship and gorgeous fits of our collection will make one steal the show, it added.

281.title: PM Modi using child for poll campaign: Cong in complaint to NCPCR
281.article_body: Congress filed a complaint with child rights body NCPCR against PM Narendra Modi, accusing him of using a minor for Gujarat election campaign. BJP had shared a video showing a girl with PM Modi hailing the party's governance. "Have also marked a copy to the Election Commission for violation of the Model Code of Conduct," tweeted Congress leader Supriya Shrinate.

282.title: Nykaa stock falls over 2% a day after CFO announces resignation
282.article_body: A day after Nykaa's Chief Financial Officer (CFO) Arvind Agarwal announced his resignation from his position effective November 25, the stock of its parent company FSN E-Commerce Ventures was trading over 2% lower on Wednesday. At 10 am, its stock was trading 2.45% lower at ₹170.90 apiece on the BSE.

283.title: One of world's largest cargo plane lands at Mumbai Airport; pics surface
283.article_body: One of the world's largest cargo plane Airbus Beluga Super Transporter made a landing at Mumbai Airport on Tuesday afternoon. It is reportedly one of the heaviest arrivals in Mumbai in the last few years. "Lucky few passengers who witnessed this giant aircraft were left awestruck by the gorgeous sight," said Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport's spokesperson.

284.title: Mumbai Police help 2 Kenyan women get back ₹15 lakh left behind in cab
284.article_body: The Mumbai Police traced a cab and recovered a bag containing ₹15 lakh, which two Kenyan women had forgotten inside the vehicle on Monday evening, police said. The women immediately approached the police and lodged a complaint. With the help of CCTV footage, police managed to get the car’s registration number and later located its driver in the Kalbadevi locality.

285.title: Gujarat BJP suspends 12 more rebels for contesting as independent candidates
285.article_body: BJP has suspended 12 more rebels for contesting as independent candidates after being denied tickets for the upcoming Gujarat Assembly polls. Those suspended include Madhu Shrivastav, Dinu Patel, Dhavalsinh Zala, Kuldipsinh Raul, Khatubhai Pagi, SM Khant, JP Patel, Ramesh Zala, Amarshi Zala, Ramsinh Thakor, Mavji Desai and Lebji Thakor. On Sunday, BJP suspended seven others over the same issue.

286.title: Punjabi actress Nikeet posts video after story about her death posted on her Instagram
286.article_body: Punjabi actress Nikeet Dhillon posted a video after a story about her death was posted on her Instagram account. Nikeet said that her account was hacked, adding, "I did not know how to react to it. How did the person (hacker) even go and do this." "We have a family that gets affected," she said in the video.

287.title: New video shows Satyendar Jain getting 'proper food' in jail after viral massage video
287.article_body: A new CCTV footage from Tihar jail showed Delhi minister Satyendar Jain getting "proper food" in jail, reported ANI. The minister has gained 8 kg of weight while being in jail, contrary to his lawyer's claims of him having lost 28 kgs, said ANI citing Tihar Jail sources. Earlier, videos of the minister getting a massage inside jail went viral.

288.title: It hurts a lot: Argentina striker Lautaro after loss vs Saudi Arabia
288.article_body: Argentina striker Lautaro Martinez said his team's 1-2 loss against Saudi Arabia in their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener "hurts a lot". "We lost...due to our mistakes...We have two finals left," added Lautaro. Reacting to his team's defeat, Argentine winger Angel Di Maria said, "We could [have] easily won 5-0...We knew Saudi Arabia were going to play like that."

289.title: 3 Pune policemen create ruckus at hotel, threaten manager; booked
289.article_body: Three policemen in Pune have been booked for allegedly creating a ruckus at Metro Hotel and threatening the manager. According to the manager, the three forced him to serve them liquor at around 1.15 am, after the place was closed and abused hotel staffers. Following the incident, a senior police officer visited the spot and a case was registered.

290.title: Man burns down property of lover's father after she refuses to elope in Maha
290.article_body: A man, having an extramarital affair, was arrested as he burned down a mini truck and a vegetable shop owned by his girlfriend’s father after she refused to move with him in Nagpur’s Waghoda village in Maharashtra, police said. They were in a relationship for the last seven months due to which his wife left him, police added.

291.title: Slept in 2-3 screenings of 'Taare Zameen Par', was young: Darsheel
291.article_body: 'Taare Zameen Par' actor Darsheel Safary shared that he attended seven screenings of the 2007 release, out of which, he "slept the last two-three times". "I was young...I remember sleeping in one premiere and when I woke up...everyone...was crying. It was gloomiest atmosphere possible," he recalled. He said, at the age of 25, he understood why the film was loved.

292.title: B2B startup Soptle raises $300,000 from Kube VC, Dunzo Co-founder
292.article_body: Soptle, B2B retail commerce startup, has secured $300,000 in an angel round led by early-stage venture capital firms Kube VC and Soonicorn LLP. Other angel investors including Dunzo Co-founder Ankur Agarwal, Fitso Co-founder Saurabh Aggarwal and Gati CEO Pirojshaw Sarkari also participated in the funding round. The startup, founded by Pravas Chandragiri, had raised an undisclosed amount in August.

293.title: Inox Green Energy Services to make its market debut today
293.article_body: Inox Green Energy Services, the wind power operation and maintenance service provider, is going to make its stock market debut on Wednesday. The company's initial public offering to raise ₹740 crore, which started on November 11 and concluded on November 15, was subscribed 1.6 times. The issue price of the IPO was ₹61-₹65 per share.

294.title: Musk cuts home internet, daycare allowance & other perks for Twitter staff: Report
294.article_body: Elon Musk has cut perks such as home internet and daycare allowance for Twitter employees, as per a report. The report, citing an internal memo, said perks being discontinued include team activities, all costs associated with "wellness," "productivity," and "new hire productivity". Musk said that "allowances will be reevaluated over time and may be added back when company's situation improves".

295.title: Truck driver accused in 48 car-pileup incident in Pune gets bail
295.article_body: A court has granted bail to the truck driver who is accused in the 48 car-pileup incident on Pune's Navale bridge on Tuesday. Meanwhile, a police officer said that the police are trying to piece together the sequence of events and technical aspects of the accident. The cleaner who was booked for aiding the truck driver was also granted bail.

296.title: Construction of Bengaluru airport Terminal 3 to start after 10 yrs: Fairfax
296.article_body: The construction of Terminal 3 of Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport (KIA) has been delayed until BIAL's (Bangalore International Airport Limited's) fiscal year 2034, Fairfax India said. BIAL is responsible for operating the KIA airport and Fairfax India owns a 54 percent stake in the company. Fairfax said this while announcing its third quarter financial results.

297.title: We need players who can run: Burnley coach Kompany on signing Ronaldo
297.article_body: Talking about Burnley potentially signing Cristiano Ronaldo after his Manchester United exit, ex-Manchester City captain and Burnley manager Vincent Kompany said, "We need players who can run." Discussing Ronaldo's exit, Kompany added, "Everybody loses apart from...the Manchester United manager." Ronaldo had earlier stated that he turned down a €350-million offer from a team in Saudi Arabia.

298.title: Ground situation is alarming, need election commission chief who can't be bulldozed: SC
298.article_body: The Supreme Court on Tuesday said that successive governments have destroyed the independence of the Election Commission of India by ensuring no Chief Election Commissioner gets the full six-year term. The court said, "Situation on the ground is fairly alarming". A Chief Election Commissioner should be someone "with character" who "does not allow himself to be bulldozed", the court added.

299.title: HP to lay off 4,000-6,000 employees globally over next 3 years
299.article_body: Computer maker HP has said that it plans to cut 4,000 to 6,000 employees globally over the next three years. In a statement, HP said its ‘Future Ready Transformation plan' should result in annualized gross run rate savings of $1.4 billion or more in the next three years, with around $1 billion in costs including restructuring.

300.title: 20-year-old man fights off leopard with stick in Thane
300.article_body: A 20-year-old man reportedly fought off a leopard using a stick near Vihigaon village of Thane district on Monday afternoon. More, who fought the animal for over 10 minutes, said, "I was holding a bunch of sticks…Then I caught hold of a bigger stick and managed to keep the big cat at bay." He suffered deep scratches on his back.

301.title: Manchester United's American owners consider selling club
301.article_body: Manchester United on Tuesday said it was starting a process to explore strategic alternatives, including a new investment or a potential sale, 17 years after the American Glazer family bought the club. The Glazer family is working with financial advisers on the process, which could lead to a partial sale of the club or investments including stadium and infrastructure redevelopment.

302.title: I prefer Hindi cinema: Pankaj on rejecting Telugu, Malayalam films
302.article_body: Actor Pankaj Tripathi shared that he has rejected offers from Telugu and Malayalam filmmakers because he feels he wouldn't be able to do justice to those films. He added that while he "prefers" and feels comfortable in Hindi cinema, he's open to working in other languages, including Hollywood, if "someone can write a Hindi-speaking character" for him.

303.title: Cyberabad Police to auction 504 abandoned, unclaimed vehicles
303.article_body: The Cyberabad Police will auction 504 abandoned or unclaimed vehicles of various types pooled at Moinabad police station grounds. The police have directed people who might have any objection or interest in relation to any of these vehicles to file an application before the police station SHO concerned and claim the vehicle within a period of six months.

304.title: Disney CEO Iger could be asked to identify his successor again: Report
304.article_body: Bob Iger, who has been named the CEO of The Walt Disney Company for the next two years, could be asked to pick his successor, Reuters reported. Part of his mandate, according to Disney, is to work with the board to develop a successor. Iger, 71, was the Disney CEO for 15 years previously and postponed his retirement four times.

305.title: Martin Guptill gives up his New Zealand central contract
305.article_body: Opener Martin Guptill has given up his New Zealand central contract. The New Zealand Cricket stated it agreed to release Guptill from his central contract so he can pursue playing opportunities elsewhere. Guptill was a part of New Zealand's T20 World Cup 2022 squad, but didn't feature in any match. The 36-year-old is the third-highest T20I run-scorer with 3,531 runs.

306.title: Little concerned about bringing up my child in public eye: Alia
306.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt said she's "a little concerned" about bringing up her child in the public eye. She said it's something that she feels "very protective about". "I talk about it with my friends, with my family, and my husband (Ranbir Kapoor) a lot. I don't want there to be a, sort of, intrusion into my child's life," she added.

307.title: Vehicle rams into school van in Gr Noida; 7-year-old girl injured
307.article_body: A seven-year-old girl was injured after a vehicle rammed into a school bus in Greater Noida on Tuesday, police said. A police spokesperson said that the girl was taken to a hospital after her parents reached the spot and her condition is stable now. Six to seven children were on board the school van, the police spokesperson added.

308.title: 4-day-old baby girl found abandoned on footpath in Mumbai
308.article_body: A four-day-old baby girl was found abandoned on a footpath in Mumbai's Borivali West by police on Monday. The officers were on patrol duty when they heard a baby crying. The girl, wrapped in a thin blanket, was rushed to a hospital. "The baby girl was cold but did not have any injury marks on her body," said an officer.

309.title: Female tourist dances on sacred pyramid as locals throw bottles at her in Mexico
309.article_body: A female tourist in Mexico was attacked by locals for climbing a sacred pyramid. In a video shared on social media, the woman is seen dancing on the sacred site as locals threw bottles at her as part of their protest. She was later brought down by a security official present at the site.

310.title: Defending champions France defeat Australia 4-1 in their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener
310.article_body: Defending champions France defeated Australia 4-1 in their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener at Al Janoub Stadium in Al Wakrah. Olivier Giroud scored a brace in the match and equalled Thierry Henry's record for scoring most goals for France (51). Giroud, aged 36 years and 53 days, also became the oldest footballer to play for France in World Cup history.

311.title: Sam Bankman-Fried ran FTX as his 'personal fiefdom', court hears
311.article_body: Bankrupt crypto exchange FTX was run as the "personal fiefdom" of 30-year-old ex-CEO Sam Bankman-Fried, lawyers representing FTX told a US bankruptcy court on Tuesday. They said FTX spent $300 million on real estate in the Bahamas for the use of its executives. "FTX was in the control of...unsophisticated individuals. Some or all of them were compromised," a lawyer said.

312.title: My love for Manchester United will never change: Ronaldo after exit from club
312.article_body: Releasing a statement after Manchester United announced that he will be leaving the club with immediate effect, Portuguese forward Cristiano Ronaldo said, "I love Manchester United and I love the fans, that will never ever change." He added, "However, it feels like the right time for me to seek a new challenge. I wish the team every success."

313.title: Criminal proceedings begin against Imran Khan in Toshakhana case
313.article_body: Criminal proceedings began against former Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan on Tuesday in the Toshakhana gifts case. Khan is accused of "deliberately" concealing "his assets relating to Toshakhana gifts retained by him, particularly in years 2018 and 2019". The Toshakhana is a Pakistani government department that stores gifts given to lawmakers and senior officials by foreign governments.

314.title: UK businesses must reduce dependence on cheap labour: Keir Starmer
314.article_body: UK's Opposition Labour Party leader Sir Keir Starmer on Tuesday said businesses in Britain must reduce dependency on cheap, migrant labour. At a business leaders summit, he said more investments should be made to train workers "who are already here". He said firms must put forth a plan on how they intend to develop the skills of British workers.

315.title: Tribals in T'gana hack official to death for opposing felling of trees
315.article_body: A 47-year-old forest official was hacked to death by a group of tribals in Telangana's Bhadradri Kothagudem when he tried to stop them from felling a tree plantation to take up 'podu cultivation'. The official, Chalamala Srinivas Rao, had gone to Bendalapadu area with a team of forest officials. "Tribals resisted and this led to a confrontation," police said.

316.title: Cristiano Ronaldo leaves Manchester United with immediate effect
316.article_body: Cristiano Ronaldo has left Manchester United by mutual agreement with immediate effect, the club announced. This comes after his interview wherein he criticised Manchester United and claimed he's being forced out of the club. "Everyone at Manchester United remains focused on continuing...team’s progress under Erik ten Hag and working together to deliver success on the pitch," the club said.

317.title: Musk asks if his tweets are considered 'work', Twitter users react
317.article_body: Billionaire Elon Musk on Tuesday tweeted, "Wait, if I tweet, does that count as work?" Reacting to this, a Twitter user said, "I'm guessing your Tesla shareholders, who're losing their shirts as [Tesla's] stock continues to make multi-year lows...might not think that you tweeting counts as work." Another user tweeted, "You're promoting your business, so it is work."

318.title: Former Italian cabinet minister Roberto Maroni dies at 67
318.article_body: Former Italian cabinet minister Roberto Maroni died on Tuesday at the age of 67 after a spell of illness. Maroni was a longtime leader of the right-wing Northern League party. Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni said Maroni had served Italy with "good sense and concreteness". Maroni served as the country's interior minister twice (1994-1995 and 2008-2011) and labour minister (2001) once.

319.title: Mexican Navy finds boat loaded with 10 tons of methamphetamines
319.article_body: The Mexican Navy on Tuesday said a patrol team found a shrimp boat loaded with approximately 10 tons of banned drug methamphetamines off its western Pacific coast. The boat was detected last week, said Navy Secretary Jose Rafael Ojeda. When the marine officials approached the vessel, its crew reportedly tried to sink the boat, he said.

320.title: Jadeja unlikely to travel to Bangladesh for Test, ODI series in Dec: Reports
320.article_body: India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja is reportedly unlikely to travel to Bangladesh for Test and ODI series in December. According to reports, Jadeja, who has been sidelined owing to an injury since this year's Asia Cup, is yet to fully recover. Notably, the Bangladesh tour, which consists of three ODIs and two Tests, will conclude by December 26.

321.title: Haven't seen son in 3 yrs: Mother of absconding Mangaluru blast suspect
321.article_body: The mother of absconding Mangaluru blast suspect Abdul Mateen Taha claimed that she hasn't seen her son in three years since he went missing from Bengaluru. She added that she hasn't seen him since he attained his engineering degree three years ago. His mother also said that if her son has done anything wrong, she wants him to be punished.

322.title: Maoists torch vehicles used for J'khand railway line construction
322.article_body: Maoists on Tuesday set ablaze around a dozen vehicles used for the construction of a railway line in Jharkhand's Latehar district, police said. In October, maoists had shot at three people in a village and asked railway line construction workers to refrain from work until levy was paid. A private construction firm is engaged in laying the 195-km-long railway line.

323.title: Centre approves ₹10,000 crore for constructing 8 lakh houses in UP
323.article_body: The Centre approved ₹10,000 crore for constructing 8 lakh houses in Uttar Pradesh under the Pradhan Mantri Gramin Awas Yojana. According to a government spokesperson, the houses will be ready by March 2024. The spokesperson added that in the last five years, 27 lakh houses have been built under the scheme and 26 lakh were handed over to the beneficiaries.

324.title: 100 Indian pilgrims arrive in Pak for Hindu saint's birth anniversary
324.article_body: Around 100 Indian pilgrims arrived in Pakistan on Tuesday to attend the celebrations of the 314th birth anniversary of Hindu saint Satguru Shadaram Sahib in Sindh province. The pilgrims entered Pakistan via the Wagah border crossing, a Pakistani official said. The pilgrims will visit the historic Shadani Darbar temple, among other holy sites, he added.

325.title: Bank deposits of Kerala college seized for 'cheating parents'
325.article_body: The bank deposits of Dr SM CSI Medical College in Thiruvananthapuram district, Kerala, worth ₹95.25 lakh have been attached under the anti-money laundering law, the Enforcement Directorate (ED) said on Tuesday. The ED alleged the college authorities cheated parents by taking money from them and promising admission to their children. "However, admissions were not given," the ED said.

326.title: Enjoying batting, expressing myself: Suryakumar on 'Player of the Series' award
326.article_body: After winning 'Player of the Series' award in three-match T20I series against New Zealand, India batter Suryakumar Yadav said he's enjoying his batting. "Just going there and expressing myself. Not carrying any baggage out there," he added. Suryakumar scored 124 runs in two innings, which includes a century he scored in second T20I to help India take a 1-0 lead.

327.title: Kejriwal's electricity model is reason for rising unemployment in Delhi: Cong
327.article_body: Congress leader Ajay Maken alleged that CM Arvind Kejriwal's electricity model is the reason for the rising unemployment in Delhi. "Delhi government gives money directly to private companies without audit. Instead of providing ₹14,731 crore as a power subsidy to consumers, it is being given directly to private companies," Maken said. Notably, Delhi civic polls will be held next month.

328.title: Gujarat CM is a 'puppet', can't even change his own peon: Kejriwal
328.article_body: AAP National Convenor Arvind Kejriwal said that Bhupendra Patel is a "puppet Chief Minister" of Gujarat and "doesn't even have the authority to change his own peon". Speaking for AAP's chief ministerial candidate in Gujarat, Isudan Gadhvi, he asked people if they wanted a 'puppet CM' or an educated CM. Kejriwal further said that Gadhvi's heart "beats for the poor".

329.title: LeT terror module busted in J&K, 4 arrested: Police
329.article_body: A Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) terror module was busted in Jammu and Kashmir's Bandipora district on Tuesday, police said. Two active terrorists and two of their associates, including a woman, were arrested by security personnel after the operation. A huge cache of arms and ammunition and materials to make an improvised explosive device (IED) were also recovered.

330.title: Amazon summoned by Labour Ministry over alleged violations in layoffs
330.article_body: Labour Ministry has summoned Amazon India's public policy manager on November 23 following a complaint by the employee union Nascent Information Technology Employees Senate (NITES) alleging violation of labour laws. NITES has alleged that Amazon is forcing employees to quit the company and has sought an inquiry. Amazon has confirmed starting layoffs, which could reportedly affect 10,000 employees.

331.title: Some fans want to kill our players: Iran manager Carlos Queiroz
331.article_body: Referring to some Iranian fans criticising their national team players for not singing National Anthem during their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener, Iran manager Carlos Queiroz said, "Whatever [the players] do, whatever they say, [some fans] want to kill them." He added, "The fans who aren't ready to support the team should stay home."

332.title: Aaditya Thackeray to meet Bihar Dy CM Tejashwi Yadav on Wednesday
332.article_body: Shiv Sena (Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray) leader Aaditya Thackeray will meet Bihar Deputy Chief Minister and RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav in Patna on Wednesday. The Maharashtra MLA will be accompanied by Rajya Sabha MPs Anil Desai, Priyanka Chaturvedi and other leaders. "It'll be a courtesy meeting," the party said. Earlier this year, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar broke ties with the BJP.

333.title: Army ready to execute order to take back PoK: Northern Command chief
333.article_body: Northern Command chief Lieutenant General Upendra Dwivedi said the Indian Army is ready to execute the order to take back Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (PoK). "If (the ceasefire is) broken at any time, we will give them a befitting reply," said L-G Dwivedi. Earlier, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said all PoK refugees in India will get their land and homes back.

334.title: Hooda hesitated on preferred batting slot, should say 'I'll replace Kohli': Kaif
334.article_body: Mohammad Kaif said India all-rounder Deepak Hooda shouldn't have "hesitated" when he was asked about his preferred batting position ahead of third T20I against New Zealand. "He should say, 'I want to bat higher up the order...want to play in place of KL Rahul. I'll replace Virat Kohli'," added Kaif. Hooda had said I'd like to bat at number five.

335.title: PhonePe raises ₹742 crore from Singapore-based parent: Report
335.article_body: Flipkart-owned digital payments platform PhonePe has reportedly received a fresh capital infusion of about ₹742 crore from its Singapore-registered parent entity PhonePe Pvt Ltd. In a regulatory filing, the Walmart-backed company’s board passed a resolution to allot a total of 3,71,753 equity shares at ₹19,968 apiece. PhonePe also reported a standalone revenue of ₹1,640 crore for FY22.

336.title: India criticises N Korea in UN for missile launch, says 'it impacts peace, security'
336.article_body: India has condemned the launch of the recent intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM) by the North Korean regime during a UN Security Council (UNSC) meeting. "Proliferation of nuclear & missile technologies is a matter of concern, as they have an adverse impact on peace & security in the region, including on India," said India's Permanent Representative at the UNSC Ruchira Kamboj.

337.title: How many jobs have they given: Tejashwi criticises PM Modi over Rozgar Mela
337.article_body: After PM Narendra Modi distributed 71,056 appointment letters through the 'Rozgar Mela' event, Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav asked, "How many jobs are they (BJP government) giving to the people of this country?" The RJD leader added, "Despite providing appointment letters, the BJP-led central government has been unable to provide jobs to the country's youth."

338.title: TRS MLA grabs govt official's collar for inaugurating school before his arrival
338.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing TRS MLA from Telangana's Gadwal, Bandla Krishna Mohan Reddy, grabbing a government official by his collar for inaugurating a school before Reddy arrived for the event. Reddy held the official's collar and pushed him as he was angered by some remark made by the official. He later clarified that he didn't attack anyone deliberately.

339.title: Denied ticket for Gujarat polls, ex-Congress MLA Rathod joins BJP
339.article_body: Former Congress MLA Kaminiba Rathod on Tuesday resigned from the party and joined the BJP in Gujarat. This comes after Congress denied her a ticket for the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections. Notably, she had also accused Congress of selling tickets for cash. She had claimed that a middleman had sought ₹1 crore from her for a ticket.

340.title: 6 killed, 4 hurt as lorry rams into mini-van in Andhra Pradesh
340.article_body: Six persons were killed after a speeding lorry rammed into a passenger mini-van in Andhra Pradesh's Alluri Sitarama Raju district near the Telangana border on Tuesday. All the victims were from Chhattisgarh and were travelling in the mini-van. They were returning after visiting the Lord Rama temple in Bhadrachalam in Telangana.

341.title: Sunny Deol had a massive ego, didn't return signing amount of incomplete film: Suneel
341.article_body: Suneel Darshan, speaking about his legal feud with actor Sunny Deol that has continued for over 25 years, accused Sunny of having a "massive ego". He had alleged that Sunny left the film 'Ajay' incomplete and refused to shoot the ending. "First, he promised to return the money. Then he said he had no money...he fooled me," said Suneel.

342.title: This is false: Meta on reports of Mark Zuckerberg resigning as CEO next year
342.article_body: Facebook parent company Meta has denied reports that claimed that CEO Mark Zuckerberg will be stepping down from his role next year. "This is false," Meta spokesperson Andy Stone said in a tweet on Tuesday. News website The Leak had reported that Zuckerberg was set to resign in 2023, which briefly sent the company's shares up 1%.

343.title: AAP turned Tihar into Thailand: BJP on Satyendar Jain's massage
343.article_body: BJP National Spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla alleged that Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and Deputy CM Manish Sisodia were aware of AAP minister Satyendar Jain getting a massage in jail. "Kejriwal must tell us how Tihar has been transformed into Thailand," said Poonawalla. He added that the AAP was "fooling" people by claiming the massage was "physiotherapy being done by a rapist".

344.title: PM Modi distributing job letters is an election stunt: Congress
344.article_body: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge on Tuesday said Prime Minister Narendra Modi handing out job letters to youths was an "election stunt". Earlier in the day, PM Modi handed out over 71,000 job letters to youths across the country via video conference. Kharge reminded the BJP government that it had promised 2 crore jobs every year.

345.title: 10 Chadian soldiers killed in Boko Haram attack near Nigeria border
345.article_body: At least 10 soldiers were killed in an attack on a Chadian military unit by Boko Haram militants in the Lake Chad region near the Nigerian border on Tuesday, Chad's government said. Several others were wounded in the attack on the island of Bouka-Toullorom. The Boko Haram insurgency, which erupted in northeast Nigeria in 2009, has killed over 3,50,000 people.

346.title: India among fastest growing Asian economies amid global slowdown: OECD
346.article_body: Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD) said India is among the fastest growing economies in Asia amid a global slowdown. OECD added India is set to be the second-fastest growing G20 economy in FY 2022-23 behind Saudi Arabia. "[India's] GDP growth is expected to slow...to 5.7% in FY 2023-24, before reverting to around 7% in FY 2024-25," OECD said.

347.title: Which companies have seen an ex-CEO return to the company besides Disney?
347.article_body: Disney's Bob Iger has returned to the company as CEO less than a year after his retirement.
