In 2000, Paul Allaire returned as Xerox CEO, and in 2013, AG Lafley returned as P&G's CEO. Steve Jobs returned as Apple's CEO in 1997 after the company was near collapse and remade it into the world's most-valued company by 2011.

348.title: Will miss Akshay Kumar in 'Hera Pheri 3': Suniel Shetty
348.article_body: Suniel Shetty said he was surprised after knowing about Akshay Kumar's exit from 'Hera Pheri 3'. When asked if he'll miss Akshay in the third part, Suniel said, "Of course, I will and that was the intention that Raju, Shyam and Babu Rao should be together." While Suniel plays the role of Shyam, Babu Rao is played by Paresh Rawal.

349.title: We have no fear & nothing to lose, we'll be 100%: Canada football coach
349.article_body: Canada coach John Herdman said the team will head into their 2022 FIFA World Cup match against Belgium with nothing to lose. “It’s exciting times now, the dark clouds have shifted...we will all be 100%,” said Herdman. He added that it had been a great, “gritty and resilient” journey to reach the tournament and there are no “elements” of fear.

350.title: Lewis Hamilton made me push my limits this year: Mercedes F1's Russell
350.article_body: Mercedes F1 driver George Russell said teammate and seven-time world champion Lewis Hamilton made him push his "limits as a driver". "I've learned a huge amount going up against somebody like him in the same car...There is no better reference," he said. Russell added that he has no doubts that Hamilton will be "back to his normal level next year".

351.title: Twitter calls lawsuit over layoffs 'baseless', says it delayed severance pay
351.article_body: Twitter has told a US federal judge that a lawsuit claiming it violated law by laying off thousands of workers without notice is "baseless". Twitter added that it met its legal obligations by informing workers that their last day would be January 4, or after 60 days. The company said the lawsuit had only caused confusion and delayed severance payments.

352.title: JSW Energy seeks shareholders' nod to appoint Parth Jindal as director
352.article_body: JSW Energy has sought shareholders' approval to appoint Parth Jindal as a Director on the company's board. The remote e-voting process for the resolution will start on November 23 and end on December 22. Parth Jindal, the son of the company's Chairman and Managing Director, Sajjan Jindal, was appointed as an additional director with effect from October 28.

353.title: 300 terrorists present in J&K, 160 waiting to enter: Army commander
353.article_body: Northern Command chief Lieutenant General Upendra Dwivedi said around 300 terrorists are currently in J&K, while 160 others are waiting to sneak in from Pakistan. He added that the security situation in the Union Territory has undergone a major change after the abrogation of Article 370. "Today, peace and development have taken the center stage," said Lieutenant General Dwivedi.

354.title: Man jailed for 6 months for letting cows roam on streets in Gujarat
354.article_body: A man has been sentenced to six months in jail for endangering people's lives by letting his cows roam on streets in Gujarat in 2019. Prakash Jairam Desai also received a two-year jail sentence for threatening members of an Amdavad Municipal Corporation team, who had gone to impound the animals. The team had found five animals roaming near Shantipur Chhapra.

355.title: Dog found carrying newborn's body in mouth inside hospital in Jaipur
355.article_body: A dog was found roaming inside the Mahila Chikitsalaya in Rajasthan's Jaipur with a newborn's body clutched in its mouth. Hospital staff took on the dog, forcing it to run away and leave the body behind. "We're unsure if the infant was born inside our hospital," said hospital superintendent Dr Asha Verma. Police have initiated a probe into the matter.

356.title: 135-year-old message in a bottle found under floor of UK home, pics surface
356.article_body: A plumber in UK's Scotland found a message in a whisky bottle, dating back to 1887, underneath the floorboards of a house. The message said, "James Ritchie and John Grieve laid this floor but they did not drink the whisky...Whoever finds this bottle may think our dust is blowing along the road." The home's owner shared pictures of the find.

357.title: 3 policemen injured in stone-pelting during protest in Chhattisgarh
357.article_body: Three policemen were injured when an agitation for a paddy procurement centre turned violent in Chhattisgarh's Gariaband district, an official said on Tuesday. The residents of Kandekela village had been demanding that the paddy procurement centre, located in Bhejipadar, be shifted to their village, he added. Protesters had allegedly pelted stones, following which some vehicles were also damaged.

358.title: Saudi Arabia manager thanks Crown Prince after defeating Argentina 2-1
358.article_body: Saudi Arabia manager Herve Renard thanked Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman for his support to the team after they beat Argentina 2-1 in a 2022 FIFA World Cup Group C match. "When we met with...Prince, he did not put any pressure on us," said Renard. He added that the team had made "history" and "it will stay" with them forever.

359.title: I'd like to bat at 5, we've legend playing at 3, I've to be realistic: Hooda
359.article_body: When asked about his preferred batting position in Team India, all-rounder Deepak Hooda said, "I'd like to bat at five, we've a legend playing at three...I've to be realistic, I can't get that spot." Batting at number six in second T20I against New Zealand, Deepak Hooda was dismissed for a duck. This was his second consecutive score of 0.

360.title: K'taka Police alert about terror activities: Bommai on Mangaluru blast
360.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Tuesday said that the Karnataka Police are alert about terror activities. "The National Investigation Agency (NIA) has initiated measures to track...movements of terror organisations, be it international or national, which is behind the Mangaluru blast suspect. We've have taken this case...seriously," he said. Police have busted 18 terror sleeper cells, he added.

361.title: BNP Paribas Arbitrage sells Wipro's shares worth ₹186 crore
361.article_body: BNP Paribas Arbitrage on Tuesday offloaded shares of IT company Wipro for ₹185.76 crore through the open market transactions. According to official data with the BSE, BNP Paribas Arbitrage sold 48,00,000 shares of the company in two tranches. Meanwhile, French financial services company Societe Generale acquired the company's shares at ₹387 per piece.

362.title: Saudi Arabia declares national holiday tomorrow to celebrate win over Argentina in FIFA WC
362.article_body: Saudi Arabia's King Salman bin Abdulaziz has declared Wednesday a national holiday to celebrate the country's victory over Argentina in 2022 FIFA World Cup. Saudi Arabia defeated Argentina 2-1 in their opening match on Tuesday. Saudi Arabia scored two goals within five minutes of each other in the second half after trailing 0-1 in the first half.

363.title: May all your dreams come true: Sara on ex-boyfriend Kartik's b'day
363.article_body: Sara Ali Khan took to her Instagram Stories on Tuesday to wish Kartik Aaryan on his birthday. "Happiest birthday @kartikaaryan...Hope this year is all that you've hoped for and may all your dreams continue coming true," she wrote. Sara and Kartik once dated each other and later parted ways, as confirmed by Karan Johar on his show 'Koffee With Karan'.

364.title: Prankster impersonating Macron spoke to Polish Prez after missile mishap
364.article_body: Poland's President Andrzej Duda spoke to a hoax caller after a suspected Ukrainian stray missile hit a Polish village near the Ukrainian border, Duda's office confirmed on Tuesday. Russian comedians Vovan and Lexus have posted a recording of the call on the internet. This was the second instance in recent years where the pranksters managed to get through to Duda.

365.title: Avatar 2 is f*****g expensive, needs to make $2 bn to be profitable: Cameron
365.article_body: Filmmaker James Cameron has said that his upcoming film 'Avatar: The Way of Water' is "very f*****g" expensive. He added that the film will have to be the third or fourth highest-grossing film in the world in order to make a profit. 'Star Wars: The Force Awakens' is the fourth-highest film currently with $2.07 billion.

366.title: FTX has cash balance of $1.24 bn, owes at least $3.1 bn: Filing
366.article_body: Collapsed cryptocurrency exchange FTX and its affiliates have a combined cash balance of $1.24 billion as of November 20, as per its new bankruptcy filing. According to a Bloomberg report, trading firm Alameda Research's cash balance stood at $401 million, while FTX Japan had $171.7 million. FTX had previously said that it owes its 50 biggest creditors nearly $3.1 billion.

367.title: Dubai airport saw more passengers than pre-COVID-19 era: Official
367.article_body: The passenger numbers at the Dubai International Airport (DXB) have surpassed pre-coronavirus pandemic levels in this year's third quarter, said an airport executive. The airport recorded 18.5 million passengers in the third quarter of 2022, which was 17.8 million passengers in 2020's first quarter. Accordingly, the airport's annual forecast has also been revised by another 1 million passengers.

368.title: Adani Enterprises plans to raise $1.8 billion: Report
368.article_body: Adani Enterprises is reportedly planning to raise $1.8 billion via a further public offering or preferential allotment. Gautam Adani's conglomerate is working with advisers on the follow-on issue and could sell the shares as soon as next year. The company's board will meet on November 25 to discuss raising funds, it said in an exchange filing on Tuesday.

369.title: Cinema down South was always much better than Bollywood: Tigmanshu
369.article_body: Filmmaker Tigmanshu Dhulia has said that cinema in South India was "always" better than Bollywood. "Telugu films used to be a bit over the top but Malayalam and Tamil used to be very good. So, was cinema in Bengal," he added. Tigmanshu stated, "Hindi audience lapped cinema when Southern industry started making multi-lingual films."

370.title: Chemicals linked to cancer, diabetes found in sanitary napkins in India: Study
370.article_body: High amounts of harmful chemicals are present in popular sanitary napkins sold in India, a study published in a report titled 'Menstrual Waste 2022' stated. The study by a Delhi-based NGO found phthalates in 10 samples of sanitary napkins available in the market. Exposure to phthalates has been linked to heart and reproductive system disorders, diabetes, and cancers, among others.

371.title: Siraj's pace is an asset, he'll succeed everywhere around the world: Taylor
371.article_body: Ex-New Zealand captain Ross Taylor has said Mohammed Siraj's "pace is an asset" after the India pacer finished as the leading wicket-taker in India-New Zealand T20I series. "You need those bowlers who can bowl 140 plus...he's going to succeed everywhere around the world and not just on wickets that bounce," he added. Siraj took total six wickets in three-match series.

372.title: Indian biologist gets UN's highest honour for saving endangered storks
372.article_body: Wildlife biologist Purnima Devi Barman is among the honourees of the UN Environment Programme's (UNEP) Champions of the Earth award 2022 in the Entrepreneurial Vision category. Barman leads the 'Hargila Army', an all-female grassroots conservation movement dedicated to protecting the Greater Adjutant stork from extinction. "Barman's...conservation work has empowered thousands of women," UNEP said.

373.title: Arittapatti village notified as Tamil Nadu's first biodiversity heritage site
373.article_body: Tamil Nadu government has declared Arittapatti village in Madurai as the state's first biodiversity heritage site. The village is surrounded by a chain of seven barren granite hillocks that act as a watershed and support close to 72 lakes, 200 natural spring pools and three check dams. The village also hosts around 250 bird species, including three flagship raptor species.

374.title: Sushant showed everyone how a TV actor could transition into films: Sharad
374.article_body: Actor Sharad Kelkar said in an interview that late actor Sushant Singh Rajput showed everyone how a TV actor could transition into films. "Hats off to him...he proved it...He set an example for everyone," Sharad added. He further said Sushant did "some excellent work" in television and films. "He always wanted to do...something great, and he achieved that," said Sharad.

375.title: We lost due to 5 minutes of mistakes: Messi on Argentina's loss vs Saudi Arabia
375.article_body: Argentina captain Lionel Messi said he did not expect to start 2022 FIFA World Cup with a loss to Saudi Arabia. "It's a situation that this group of players have never been through...in five minutes of mistakes...we went 1-2 down," he said. Messi added that the Saudi team "did not surprise" as he knew "they could do that".

376.title: Hindu Mahasabha to rename Meerut after Godse if elected to power
376.article_body: Hindu Mahasabha on Tuesday said it will rename Meerut as Nathuram Godse Nagar if its candidate is elected as the Mayor in the upcoming municipal polls. Abhishek Agarwal, Hindu Mahasabha's new chief of Meerut district for the urban body elections, said that the first promise is to make India a "Hindu Rashtra", adding that patriotic candidates will be identified.

377.title: More Aftab-Shraddha too, India needs strict anti-jihad laws: Assam CM
377.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Tuesday said that India needs strict 'anti-jihad' laws while referring to the murder of Shraddha Walkar, who was killed by her live-in partner in Delhi. "When police asked why he brought only Hindu girls, he said he did it because they are emotional," Sarma said, adding that only BJP could end forced religious conversions.

378.title: Zorba, India's first dog to be deployed for tracking down poachers, dies
378.article_body: Zorba, India's first dog to be deployed for tracking down poachers, died in Guwahati, Assam due to old age. The 12-year-old male Belgian Malinois was a member of 'K9', the nation's first dog squad for wildlife crimes. With an 8-year career covering several rhino protection areas in Assam, Zorba was actively engaged in anti-poaching operations.

379.title: One word, Surya: Zaheer on positives for India from T20I series vs NZ
379.article_body: On being asked to pick positives for India in the T20I series against New Zealand, Zaheer Khan said, "One word: Suryakumar Yadav." "The way Surya was batting was too good, destructive...This was the last T20I in...calendar year and he has scored close to 1,200 runs in the whole season," he added. Suryakumar scored 111* and 13 in the three-match series.

380.title: Won't let Pakistan smuggle weapons, drugs into India: Lt Gen Dwivedi
380.article_body: Lieutenant General Upendra Dwivedi on Tuesday said that Pakistan is trying to smuggle pistols, grenades and drugs into India to create small incidents of unrest in the country. "We'll not let [this] happen," the General Officer-Commanding-in-Chief of Northern Command added. He stated that the Indian Army will always be ready to execute government orders like taking back Pakistan-occupied Kashmir.

381.title: 5.86 lakh differently-abled persons in K'taka given UDID cards: Minister
381.article_body: Karnataka Health Minister Dr K Sudhakar on Tuesday said the state has distributed 5.86 lakh Unique Disability Identification Cards (UDID). "Ramanagara district has the highest number of cards distributed, followed by Chikkamagaluru, Bagalkote, Haveri, Uttara Kannada, Belagavi and Mandya districts," Sudhakar said. He further urged people with disabilities to register their names on the UDID portal.

382.title: Law & order in northeast improved after Modi govt came to power: Tripura CM
382.article_body: Tripura CM Manik Saha on Tuesday said that the law and order situation of the northeastern states has improved significantly under the leadership of PM Narendra Modi. "The government has adopted a 'Zero Tolerance' policy to deal with crimes," Saha said. He added that interstate issues have also been resolved with the efforts of the Modi government.

383.title: What records did India break in T20I cricket in 2022?
383.article_body: India played a total of 40 T20Is this year, the most by any team in a calendar year. India recorded most T20I wins in a calendar year (28). Suryakumar Yadav broke the record for slamming most sixes in a calendar year (68). Further, Rohit Sharma broke the record for winning most T20Is as captain in a year (21).

384.title: Today is a sad day: Argentina manager on team's 1-2 loss to Saudi Arabia
384.article_body: Speaking after Argentina's 1-2 loss to 51st-ranked Saudi Arabia in their first match in FIFA World Cup 2022 on Tuesday, Argentina manager Lionel Scaloni stated, "Today is a sad day but as we always say, chin up and keep going." Saudi Arabia scored both their goals in second half after Argentina captain Lionel Messi scored via penalty in the 10th-minute.

385.title: Major UK swimming pool operator cuts opening hours to save energy costs
385.article_body: A major British swimming pool operator has announced a reduction in its opening hours in wake of the high energy bills affecting households and businesses across Europe. Over 200 leisure centres and swimming pools across Britain will remain open for two hours less than usual on certain days to save on heating and lighting costs, said Greenwich Leisure Limited (GLL).

386.title: 5 bacteria types caused 6.8 lakh deaths in India in 2019: Lancet study
386.article_body: Five bacteria types — E. coli, S. pneumoniae, K. pneumoniae, S. aureus and A. baumannii — caused nearly 6.8 lakh deaths in India in 2019, according to a study published in The Lancet journal. E. Coli was the most deadly pathogen, claiming 1.57 lakh lives in India in 2019. Common bacterial infections were linked to one in eight deaths globally.

387.title: I will attend the FIFA World Cup final in Qatar: Varun Dhawan
387.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan said that he'll be going to Qatar to attend the final of the FIFA World Cup. When asked to choose between Argentina and Brazil, Varun stated, "I hope Brazil gets in over Argentina. Actually, Argentina aur Brazil mereko dono chalega (I don't really mind either of them winning)." The final will be played on December 18.

388.title: I'm in touch with Charu, I send her nice WhatsApp messages: Rajeev Sen
388.article_body: Actor Rajeev Sen shared a video on his YouTube channel where he said that he's in touch with his estranged wife Charu Asopa, adding that he keeps sending her nice WhatsApp messages. "I try to be nice to her...Making her feel that yes, I'm there, even though we are not physically there with each other," he added.

389.title: Telangana forest officer killed in attack by tribals grazing cattle
389.article_body: A forest officer in Telangana died after he was attacked by two men armed with axes while he was trying to evict tribals illegally grazing cattle on forest plantations on Tuesday. Srinivas Rao was the recipient of KVS Babu Gold Medal for forest protection in his range in 2021. CM K Chandrashekar Rao announced an ex-gratia payment of ₹50 lakh.

390.title: Would love to collaborate with Kartik for 'Pyaar Ka...': Divyenndu
390.article_body: Actor Divyenndu has refuted reports stating he'll reunite with actor Kartik Aaryan for 'Pyaar Ka Punchnama 3' and said there have been no talks over it. "But would love to collaborate with Kartik...We all began together so that will always be a team close to my heart," he added. Divyenndu and Kartik made their debut with 'Pyaar Ka Punchnama'.

391.title: India will grow to become $40 trillion economy by 2047: Mukesh Ambani
391.article_body: Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani on Tuesday said, "As the Amrit Kaal unfolds, India will witness an unprecedented explosion in economic growth and opportunities." "From a 3 trillion-dollar economy, India will grow to become a 40 trillion-dollar economy by 2047, ranking among the top three economies of the world," Ambani said at the 10th convocation of Pandit Deendayal Energy University.

392.title: Surprised by Congress leaders' praise for Sardar Patel: Amit Shah
392.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that he is surprised that Congress leaders are praising Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel and said that they left no stone unturned to insult him. Shah alleged that Congress performed Patel's last rites in an "unceremonious manner". He further said that Congress has started praising Patel only in view of the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections.

393.title: Iraqi auditors find embezzlement of $2.5 billion of tax income
393.article_body: Around $2.5 billion (3.7 trillion Iraqi dinars) of the Iraqi government's tax income has been embezzled, Iraqi auditors have found. This development, which was first reported by The Guardian, is being viewed as potentially the biggest corruption scam under ex-Prime Minister Mustafa al-Kahdimi. In Transparency International's clean governance index (2021), Iraq ranked 157th out of 180 countries.

394.title: Sabarimala pilgrims can keep coconuts in flight cabin baggage
394.article_body: The Bureau of Civil Aviation Security (BCAS) has allowed Sabarimala pilgrims to carry coconuts in cabin baggage on flights for a limited period of time. Currently, according to rules, coconuts are not permitted in cabin baggage as they are flammable. According to an official, additional security measures and checks have been put in place with regard to this.

395.title: High-ranking Bhutanese monks arrive in India to visit Buddhist sites
395.article_body: A delegation of 24 high-ranking Bhutanese monks arrived in India on Tuesday for a spiritual and academic tour. The monks will meet top Indian officials in Delhi and visit Buddhist holy sites, including Nagarjunakonda in Andhra Pradesh and Buddhavanam in Telangana. The International Buddhist Confederation, which has organised the trip, said the visit will strengthen ties between Bhutan and India.

396.title: SC to hear NIA's plea against bail to Elgar Parishad accused Teltumbde
396.article_body: The Supreme Court agreed to hear the National Investigation Agency's (NIA's) appeal against the bail granted to scholar-activist Anand Teltumbde in the Elgar Parishad case. Taking note of the submissions by Solicitor General Tushar Mehta, CJI DY Chandrachud said that the matter will be heard on Friday. Teltumbde was granted bail by the Bombay High Court on November 18.

397.title: Actors now are insecure, concerned about money they take home: Suniel
397.article_body: Actor Suniel Shetty, speaking about why it is difficult to make two-hero films nowadays, has said that each actor is insecure about themselves. "Each one talks about the amount of money he wants to take home and not about how much money he wants to put into the product," he further added. Suniel will soon feature in 'Hera Pheri 3'.

398.title: Congress leader's daughter abducted from Jaipur vegetable market
398.article_body: A Congress leader's 21-year-old daughter was allegedly abducted by unidentified persons in Jaipur when she had gone to buy vegetables, police said. The Congress leader said that his daughter was on her scooter and had called him to say that some men were chasing her. The girl's scooter was later found abandoned, while the market's vendors remain clueless, said police.

399.title: Man forces woman to engrave his name on her body with blade in UP
399.article_body: A 25-year-old nursing student was arrested on Tuesday for allegedly forcing a 21-year-old woman to write his name on her private parts with a blade and circulating the video on social media. The accused made obscene videos of the victim holding her at knifepoint. He threatened to kill her and her parents if she refused to marry him, reports said.

400.title: Think big, green & digital 3 mantras to make India green energy leader: Ambani
400.article_body: Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani shared three mantras to achieve success in the mission of making India a green energy leader. Addressing the convocation of Pandit Deendayal Energy University (PDEU), he said the three mantras were "Think Big", "Think Green" and "Think Digital". Ambani added that green energy "is a goal each one of you should pursue in mission mode".
